content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Great game, I highly recommend this to anyone who at any point enjoyed minecraft, which is fair to say a wide variety of people have that play video games.This game is extremely fun and is obviously going to be compared to Minecraft due to the fact it is a voxel based game.Top marks to the developers :D Pros Music To whoever made the tracks in-game I offer you a high five my friend!Crafting The crafting system is very well made. For you to be able to create some items (mining cells for example) you need to create its less valuable counter-part. Which I for one really enjoyed on my first world because you don't know what you will unlock in the futureServers/worlds The system in-game for the worlds in amazing in my opinion and have found it to be rather extraordinary, probably because I have not encountered this kind of thing before. Every world you/your friend creates will save and for example if your friend leaves the world he creates whilst you're both connected, you will remain in world and are still able to play-through the game as per usual. I'm not entirely sure how it works but I have found it rather handy for this feature to be in game.Gameplay I personally was expecting this game to be a bit of a bum, probably because I instantly thought of the hundreds of minecraft rip-offs there are but my friend got it so we both decided to take the game "For a spin". Instantly we were both 'wowed' by the extensive world and great crafting system and number of new options available to us!Graphics There really isn't much to say about graphics but that they are very good for a voxel based game title, I was rather shocked with the detail of shading in some places and marvelled at the fab-u-lus view from my tree base. looking over the mountains.  -Cons  In my opinion this game is amazing so I'm going to name a few improvements I think could be made.Items I personally believe that this game should have a few more weapon choices (ranged) and extra armour/clothing too, some rare gear/items could be placed around the world with a somewhat 'mini-boss' guarding whatever the gear/items may be. Me and my friend have come up with a number of ideas such as 'Goo-Boots' which reduce fall damage/make you bounce without a block being underneath you. Items like this would be rather nice and would seperate this game from minecraft and other voxel titles even further.Character Customization I positive this has been said before and I'm sure it will be said again. This game would be amazing with customised characters, I'm not asking for the 'skins' from minecraft to be put in the game but I would quite like an RPG style customization in-game, even if it was just complextion, hair, eye and voices even that would be rather nice.Sounds I think it would be rather nice for your character in-game to have some voice emotes like laughing etc, this would again bring the game further away from other voxel based titles.Animations Along with the voice emotes, visual emotes such as waving could be added or even combine the visual and sound emotes together for example with the laughing emote.

content:
Posted: January 18
Early Access Review
								Ok so .. i recently upgraded to Pro and i thought i should atleast write a review about the core game. This game is definately to me far better than minecraft ever was or ever will be .. its like minecraft on steroids.. I love the music though its so soothing that sometimes it makes me sleepy and doze off lol .. The graphics are nicely done and the animations feel very solid. The crafting system doesnt leave you clueless and confused but instead guides you along your way with blueprints and informational tooltips that show you what is needed to either craft or unlock items that are either locked or unlocked respectfully. The game is 100% free to play and not a single dime is needed to be spent to unlock anything in this game. That being said you do have the option to spend real money for in-game premium currency to unlock special blocks and blueprints if you just dont feel like gathering the needed materials. There is also the Creativerse Pro DLC which unlocks a glider, flashlight, faster run speeds, longer sprint time before getting tired, more backpack space, the ability to change the way the sky looks, the ability to customize your world to your hearts content like changing all creatures to be friendly and turning off gravity for some pretty fun space walking (which makes it useful in some situations).I totally recommend getting this game and supporting the devs! These guys have done a tremendous job on this game and they push out updates very often. If your new to the building games or if your a master builder all kinds of play styles will find this game enjoyable and fun to play.

number of helpful: 41 of 59 people (69%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								When it says, "Free to Play", thats their way of saying, "Yes, you can play the watered down version that is not enjoyable, but at least you can have ONE world at a time, with no way of changing it. But you can spend $20 to have the Premium (AKA the game)"This game went from a glorious sandbox builder to a 'Pay to Play' in one update. The update that added Premium, a DLC which entited the owner to new items, new world options, and a exclusive block set. The catch? Well, lets just say you will wish you had the game sooner. The update removed ALL the world customizing options from non-premium owners. If you had a world that had implemented customizers, you were good. If not, you could only have 1 world at a time, with no way to have peaceful monsters, hard mode, reduced spawns, and more. (With the last update, 9/14 I believe, it removed all of my previous cusomizers) But if you have $20 laying around for no reason, this game is for you!Pros:-LOTS of different furniture pieces and decorative blocks-Varied monsters and creatures-Vast worlds with many biomes-Many types of ores and nature blocks-Free (to an extent)Cons:-Not really free per say-Not much for non-premium owners-Difficult to collect building recipes-Cusomization is a little weakOverall:This is an ok game for an Early Access. Lacking of certain aspects that could very much improve gameplay, this game has it where it counts. There is a lot you can do when it comes to building and exploring. But, Premium 'punishes' players that did not buy the beta, dramatically removing features for non-premium owners. Overall, this is a good game, far superior to games like Minecraft. But if you dont have any spare change, this game is not all it is shown to be.Thank you for taking the time to read this(Listed as a negative review only because of the premium... and the glitch that has me mad at this point)Have a nice day :D

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								WOW what a great game.I want to start this review by addressing the two primary "problems" that are frequently mentioned in the  negative reviews for this game.1: Concerning restrictions on Non-Pro accounts. - I played this game for around 22 hours with a F2P/Non-Pro account and had an enourmous ammount of fun. The restrictions are not very limiting (at least for solo play, not sure for SMP). 2: Games aren't free to make, OF COURSE THEY HAVE A WAY TO MAKE MONEY FROM THIS GAME. - I want to be very clear here. I bought a pro account not to lift the restrictions. I bought a pro account because I wanted to pay the devs for making such a delightful game. Making games takes a lot of time, effort, and in many cases money. They are not being ridiculously greedy with this one (it's $20 people, not $60). Additionally, you absolutely DO NOT have to buy a pro account to fully enjoy this game. The Microtransactions that are available in-game are also not EVEN IN THE SLIGHTEST neccesary to play this game. Now that's out of the way, here's why I love this game:Creativers is a visually stunning, immersive, sandbox crafting experience. Very simlar to other crafting games (such as Minecraft) but with a lot of unique characteristics. The concept of "blueprints" is rather unique and enjoyable. Although admittedly the blueprints are not always the best looking structures.The addition of teleporters to the game is fantastic. I was at first concerned it would make the game too "easy" or "boring" to be able to TP to any of my bases, but holy cow is it useful and great.Long story short, it's a F2P game. Download it and try it out. If you end up enjoying it as much as me, I encourage you to buy the pro version FOR ONLY $20 to show the devs some support for making such a beautiful and fun game.Happy gaming!

Early Access Review
Personal Rating : "Could be better"Traditional Rating : 6.8/10Creativerse surely have so many potential to achieve, but still the game feels somewhat not desireable.The game itself works pretty well, with gameplay and mechanic similar to its predecessor, Minecraft. Little things here and there mostly the same; crafting, mining, mob killing, dungeon and underground cave, et cetera.Long story short; It's just an upgraded version of MinecraftUpgraded means there are some things that Creativerse offer more than the old, or is it?Positive :The graphics are beautiful, cloud, trees, and especially the backgrounds are stunning.More diverse crafting possibilities, with creation not just rely on benchwork, but with many other types of tools.More specific items for every needs; roof, wall, stair, floorfor now on this the only thing I can say to be the positive..Negative:Crafting is very hard to do here, for an item (like similarly iron sword), need so many ingredients and hard to find make it barely possible to create without depleting other item's durabilityMobs are just literally & figuratively painful, they look different but behave just the same. Not having different abilities or else.Health regen more like in real life; it get at least 3 days to heal, not even sleep make you full health again.Cave are no enter zone, the mobs too hard to defeat without proper equipment, but you need materials from inside the cave to make proper equipment. (and back to first point, where items durability are very short) :(Possible microtransaction in the future, there's a store page inside the game.No LAN or direct connection available, everything tied to the server in NAInability to play in offline is the worst, even when you have the world saved to your pc, you just can't. (already try steam offline mode, click on the .exe)My suggestion, this one is a promising game, but not that worth it for this time around, I hereby recommend for you to try—for people who wants to be involved in the progress of the game—.

number of helpful: 19 of 21 people (90%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								I picked up this game a few days ago and forgot about it. And then sunk my evening yesterday into it. For Minecraft players, they'll find this game familiar yet fresh and different. There are a few really minor thinga that make the play experience much nicer than Minecraft, for me. One major thing is jumping. You can jump 2 blocks straight up and you can jump across a pretty wide gap. The other thing is mining. Rather than stand there and swing your pickaxe like a fool, you simply place the gatherer, and walk away. Then when you come back when it's finished, and your ores are sitting there all nice waiting for you. Eating also isn't a necessity. Which I know will be a point of contention for some, but rather it's there to boost your play experience rather than hinder it. There are some other things, like falling damage, that are equally convenient but you won't notice so much.There are also features you may notice from many popular Minecraft full mods. The death beacon is a major one where you can collect your items you dropped on death (but your quick bar handily remains on your person!). Equally convenient and awesome are personal and craftable teleporters. You can set teleporters to travel to eachother, and players in your world can travel directly to your person teleporter. This is especially handy when playing with a friend and you're able to explore without a concern in the world about getting lost. There's also many different overworld mobs with different varieties for biomes. And dozens of items to pick up off the ground you'll think you're chasing butterflies in Skyrim.That said, there are a handful of things I find cumbersome coming from the super flexibile Minecraft background. First and foremost is recipe progression. Personally, I don't like having to 'find' recpies only after creating the items that are lower than it. Even though I can't create it, I like to see where I'm headded for eventually (a la Don't Starve). Also having to refine every item at the processor is a bit of a drag. It makes it so that your cave dives eventually have to turn back home or hole up and take a long pause while you refine the stone you need for more gatherers. I also found combat and taming to be quite clunky. I may not be getting the full grasp on how it plays properly but from what I gathered, you're pretty much guaranteed to take damage. The combat system heavily focuses on your gear rather than your ability to kite and hit. Taming falls on the same spectrum: while you're ringing your bell it seems like you just stand there and take damage. There are a few non-obvious ways to avoid taking damage, but I'd personally like to see it play a bit more 'obviously'.Overall, I highly recommend this game. It's a slightly different, yet familiar, take on the sandbox construction/survival genre and I think plays really well. It's a smooth experience that does a pretty great job of guiding newbies into it through individual tasks, though a wiki will still always be your best friend. It's a great early access game with a few minor hiccups (most of the stuff I noticed is graphical glitches) but doesn't interfere with your play experience.

content:
Posted: March 3
Early Access Review
								This is the first review I've written on steam and felt I had to leave one for this game after installing it today. Despite only installing it today I've played it for six hours solid and I only stopped playing because it's nearly 5am and I have to get to bed! I could play have longer if not. This is very similar to minecraft in terms of feel but with one major difference - it's a lot better than minecraft! The controls are similar, the gameplay is similar but very much improved, the graphics are a perfect balance of pixel and shaded. It all makes for a very enjoyable experience. The extra depth in this game is what was missing from minecraft. Having spent ages playing that I was looking for something new. I never found anything that filled the gap till now. This game being free makes it even better. Although I paid for pro membership and I'm glad I did. The flashlight and glider although not major things make a massive difference to gameplay. The single player option works well. It's good to get to grips with the game. But the multiplayer mode is fantastic. The community is really welcoming and within ten minutes of joining an online session I had people helping me out and getting me going in to proper gameplay. It's a really fun world to explore. The crafting is really well thought out and I love the rewarding feeling of unlocking items. It really motivates you to keep going. I'll be playing this a lot. It's highly recommended.

Early Access Review
								The devs have renounced their anti-Pay-to-Win philosophies with the most recent update. New players can no longer customize their world, nor create more than one world. You must now pay $20 in order to "go pro" and gain access to the full game and enjoy additional content in the future. It was a great F2P game prior to this update, with all the paid content being cosmetic and overall inconsequential, but now its no longer a true F2P. I would still recommend it if you don't mind paying the $20 upgrade fee in order to fully enjoy the game, and I suppose it's still an ok free game, but if you came here looking for a F2P sandbox game where everyone has a level playing field, I suggest you look somewhere else.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game wasn't that great before- To be honest, it actually seemed like a rip off of Minecraft. Yes, a good one, with great visuals, easy multiplayer, and a few mechanics not found in Minecraft. But recently it's somewhat blended Terraria and Minecraft together, with the luxury of Minecraft's 3D, easy multiplayer, and stuff, with Terraria style character customization and greater amount of content over Minecraft. Yes, it doesn't have as much content as Terraria, and never will, to be honest. But now it's blended the 2 most popular sandboxes, along with content not found in either, such as a tutorial. Well done. If it's to be called a rip off byb ANYONE, it's a very, very good one.Basically, it combines Minecraft's style of gameplay with Terraria's progression in equipment, and where you go. You might not be going far without decent equipment......And now is when it hits the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.Creativerse Pro- A Builders club style subscription service allowing for Flashlights, Gliders, and various exclusive blocks. Y'see, with F2P games there is ALWAYS a catch, whether it be excessve ads, or what you're probably used to, Micro-transactions. I quite literally knew that the game would come to this someday, as a F2p game. I literally knew it. Yes, you can argue that those features aren't necessary, but there's something about a free indie game going into the We-Do-Want-Money category, just like Roblox. Atleast this isn't as bad as the removal of tix, but it just rubs me the wrong way. Despite that, i can't not give this game a reccomendation. It's still a great game to play with friends, so go do that.

So far building I wish took notes from trove where it predicted where you wanted to build and hold+drag to place multiple of the same block at once. Most definitely needs an improvement since I want to be able to build while surviving unlock minecraft where i have to go admin mode4. Weirdly moving you do not just move over 1 block automatically, I wish that was changed for more QoL movement5. Very artistic designs a plus for you graphic junkies6. I love that you can buy some stuff from the store and everyone on the server can help build it, to my understanding7. Combat so far since im still inexperinced: the enemies so far are pretty diverse and do many entertaining actions however I wish that as the player i had more than just a "homerun/swing and a miss" sword....8. Very friendly UI which can sometimes be overlooked in game making9. Character customization needs work, that's a must...and I kinda want more than a 12 year old even if they are great for a default design10.  Water logic is pretty boring you dont just sink which is true irl but I prefer minecraft/trove/starbound water to this.... water in minecraft/trove makes fun trap potential and starbound great for helping with exploring11. Taming monsters is really cool12. The fact that the game stays up, your world, friend's worlds, all stay open even while you're offline is a huge plus esp if some friends are in different time zones13. When you start out with a few recipes, every time you craft an item it unlocks the next tier however with every item crafted it's easier to build another item(so far most of the time it isn't the next tier but a different item type) this can feel a tad linear but to me it helps prolong your exploration since you have to take your time and discover all the secrets in the world instead of just digging through everything and reaching the core of a planet(i'm looking at you starbound) or just falling into the void(hai minecraft), or hitting a undestroyable boundry(you're lucky you have rpg  trove <3)14.I would love to see where they go with this because so far it does have huge potential15. They should also do like trove and say in the tooltip where an item mat can be foundI might add more to the review later but I just realized I might be late for class wish me luck and carry on adventurers!

content:
Posted: March 13
Early Access Review
IntroductionCreativerse is a crafting game made by Playful Corporation. This game is an Early Access game which means there will be lot of updates to the game i assume and you can play alone, with your friends and the people you do not know. I expect developers of this game to keep updating the game and adding more stuff.I tried to play alone but it was boring. Then, i told my friends to download it and we started to play. The game is good and enjoyable. I recommend you to play with your friends. Otherwise, it will be boring. This is my opinion so if you think playing alone is not boring then give it a try.You discover blocks and other stuff and then you craft them and when you craft them, you discover new stuff and when you craft them you discover new stuff. But you need resources to craft it. That's how it works.BlueprintsThere are blueprints in this game but they are not free ofc. You need to pay to get coins so you can buy the blueprint then start to build it. Building takes lot of time and resource so i'd recommend you to buy both blueprint and kit thing which gives all resources you need.PerformanceLet's talk about performence. I have got Intel I7 2640M Cpu, 8GB Ram, Intel HD Graphics 3000 Integrated GPU. When i was playing this game, i had fps drops and i was playing on low graphic settings. I think i will try to play this game again after i buy a good computer.Buying PremiumI think buying premium is not a good idea because it does not give you too much things. Let me tell you what you will get if you buy the premium. You can run more, you get more options when you want to change some settings of your world. You get a flashlight which you can use and you get ability to fly which will make building easier.Pros1- You can create your own world and invite people easy without dealing with ports etc.2- You can make teleporter in this game which will make traveling between your places easy.3- When you die, you do not loose items on your slot but you loose items on your inventory.Cons1- Boring to play alone. Seriously, play with your friend.2- Repetitive game. Which means you will most likely enjoy the game when you are playing it for the first time but after playing it like 5 hours or more then you will get bored.3- Premium is not worth buying. It does not give you anything except ability to fly which makes building easier, running more, ability to change more options of your own world and flaslight which you can use at dark places like caves.4- The game does not have lot of things to discover.5- It is really hard to find diamonds, iron etc.6- Lack of things to discover and craft.Score: 5/10

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								i am not a minecraft person...i can't build...so if i play mc at all i just sit there and break blocks and try to find precious stones.  my daughter is very much a mc person...she has it on every platform possible and she plays it fairly regularly.  i got this, because it was free and something we could check out together....we opened it and next thing we knew 5 hours had passed.  we both love it.  it has a good sense of humor.  i like that it is easy to recover from getting lost, there is a map to your death so you can recover your stuff.  the crafting system is fun....there are just shy of 400 things to craft and you have to unlock most of them but it gives you clear instructions as to how...which include forging in your forge...mining...gathering...processing materials.  so each thing has a unique route to the next thing.  there are treasures scattered through the map that include recipes...today we found halloween decorations as well as christmas ones...also clothes for pets we will some day tame.i am very interested to see what the game will turn in to as it is pretty polished as is.

content:
Posted: February 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I first loaded this game I thought to myself... Welp, this looks like Minecraft lol.. I've played a few Minecraft knockoffs, and this... This is not Minecraft. This is something else entirely. Yes, it's a sandbox game where you can pick blocks up and put them back down but the differences are huge.I started playing with buttons and quickly picked up which were the crafting menu and inventory, saw that I needed some initial resources to start crafting with. Instead of being able to craft anything in the game if you simply have the materials, you unlock newer, better recipes via crafting the first ones.. Alright, I can do this lol. It took me a good 30 hours of gameplay (mind you, I had started my own private world so I had no help) to dig down to the bottom of the world and craft the best armor and weapons. I had to traverse the globe in search of specific creatures in order to use their items to craft stuff in order to dig deeper. It is super fun figuring it out for yourself, as opposed to minecraft's 'start the game, dig some stone, build castle' it feels a lot more like an adventure and learning experience.The game is unfinished, and is already stomping out Minecraft. The only thing I kinda miss is Redstone.. And not very much lol.

content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Video: 7/10Audio: 8/1Gameplay:3/10At first play, it was amazing. I had finally found a game that was F2P. You could literally get the FULL experience, simply by spending the 10 minutes for the download. Yeah, sure, there was stuff you could buy. Blocks. Thats all. Alright. Amazing. I enjoyed many hours like this with my mother, and my close friends. There were permissions for your servers, and you could set up admins, moderators, and even just have visitors. It was amazing. Everything I wanted in a Free to Play game. Similar to TF2, you could simply spend cash for "Cosmetics" (In this case, Blocks).I saw they had an update to the game, and I got a bit excited. I was hoping they added new content, and tweaked out some of the bugs. NOPE. They decided to add some "Pro" version of the game. New players now can not make more than one world, and they can no longer edit the features of that world. I had a world with 9 players. My friends can no longer use explosives, access my extractors, my chests, my blueprints, or my pets. They added some glider, and a flashlight, in order to give "Pro" players an edge. They essentially switched from their (very firm) Free to Play, to a P2W. What a joke. I HIGHLY encourage you not to waste your time with this. Two days ago, I would have said go for it. I even convinced a few sceptical players to try it, and they loved it. Now, every single one of those 9 players are uninstalling the game. Summary: F2P tag is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Go play Minecraft instead.

number of helpful: 18 of 25 people (72%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game may seem like a clone of minecraft, but the reality is- it's not. Sure the world is based in a blocky enviroment, you can mine and build with individual blocks, that is similar to minecraft, but it's also similar to every voxel-based game out there. I love the crafting system. Think of it like ARK: Survival Evolved, in which you need engrams to make the tools. You unlock upgrades by making the former item. Also, searching for materials does not get boring! It isn't hard to get the basic materials, but the ones later in the game? Yeah, those can be difficult to get to. Also, once you have a base of operations, it doesn't get repetetive, you still have to quest to get those items, whether it be 6 stone to make 48 stone rods for that stack of stairs your making, or the Feral Pigsy Fur for the Iron Sword- it doesn't get boring. (Well, the stone mining does- but that's besides the point!) Instead of making all your tools in one machine, placing all your items in one type of chest- you have different types of them. You want to make a door? Get a processor to process that wood. What was that? You wanted a bar of obsidian? Get that forge. Wait, what was that? You wanted to COOK an APPLE PIE? Get the Cooking machine for that. You need a better chest because the normal, 20 slot one isn't working for you? Get an ARC stone chest. Gameplay: Now the gameplay and combat systems are alot like minecraft. It is a point N' click kind of game, no blocking (Yet), but it still retains a certain air about it that makes it original. You can't chose your game mode- it's already at the default setting- Life. Movement and all, it has a very nice flow. The animations are nice, You can run, jump- move about freely and as you wish, and best of all, you can seem badass by hopping from treetop to treetop. Graphics: The graphics are not like Minecraft. I mean sure- It's pixelated- but all games are pixelated. There's really not much to say about it, other than it has better graphics than Minecraft.Over all, I throuroghly enjoyed this game. I would recomend it to all those looking to take a break from minecraft and to refresh your senses, as I did. Oh and one more thing, just to let you guys know- I have played more than my fair share of minecraft as well... Probably over 400 hours of it. That will be all I will say on this subject, until (or if) I decide to revise this. [Unedited]

Early Access Review
								While it may be similar to MInecraft, Creatifverse diverges greatly from MC. More are available to the player to use, craft with, craft, and decorate. Way more mobs and the mobs are significantly harder to take down; they also deal more damages. So getting better weapons, armour, and a steady supply of health potions is crucial. However, getting resources is also a dificult challenge. THe further you go down the more enemies and the stronger they are, but also the more valuable resources. SO stack up !!You can also get a pet which in turn gives you free items, as long as you take care of it. My first pet was a rockster! But i lost him. It's been days(in game) since i've seen him. All I've had is my pigsy, Pig-o-tron, to comfort me, Moreover, this game is best played with more people. You'll need to them to coordinate attacks, gather sources and build. The world is huge and unforgiving. Great game, I will continue to play !!! 100/10

number of helpful: 14 of 18 people (78%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								I went into this game just thinking I would spend a few hours trying it out now I've been playing this game for four or five days with a couple of friends of mine and have already gotten 36 hours playtime into it, not sure where all of that time went but we seem to be enjoying ourselves. From a first glance it looks a lot like minecraft but I really feel it doesn't play anything like that at all it has enough differences and unique features that Minecraft could actually get a few ideas from Creativerse. I've seen a lot of negative reviews on the game stating things like Pay 2 Win but how can you have P2W in a non competitive game? Additionally most of the complaints I see in the negative reviews seem to have been addressed and removed from the game or fixed since the game has gone free to play. Yes the game has an ingame real money shop but you start out with currency for it so if you really want a specific cosmetic block you can get it for free anyways, Play with a group of friends and you can all claim different things and you've gotten almost everything for free. Pros:-Free to Play-Replay ability-All recipes are obtainable in game now without spending real money which was a common complaint I saw in other reviews.-Graphics look amazing-Multiplayer is set up amazing, Anyone can set up a world without fussing around with downloading server files because it's all hosted online for free. *Note* While I would like to continue listing things here I feel like it would just become a really long list of the games features such as Monster taming, The farming system, the Blueprints system and most of the other features in the game.Cons:-No brightness slider, This may be a personal thing since none of my friends seemed to have any difficulties but when the game is dark it's very dark I couldn't see more than a few blocks infront of me if at all. -Very little character customization, you get to chose between male and female that's all for character customization. -There are premium items that aren't attainable to everyone, like a limited sword for people who attended Pax, As a completionist this type of thing tends to bug me but again it isn't really a con just my personal opinion. Overall I would give this game a full score 10/10 while the game isn't for everyone it is a great game to jump into with friends if you like other games of this type or have never played one but don't feel like investing this is a great way to try the style of play out, Don't think it's like the others though this game has a decently difficult armor and tools progression and a the art style is pretty nice to look at.  I would definitely recommend this game to others even if they are just looking for something to kill a weekend with.

								For a free-to-play (and early-access) game this has shown how a better "copy" of Minecraft should be.If you ask me though, this has  a lot of differences compared to minecraft. number of helpful: 12 of 15 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								As someone whose all-time favorite game starts with 'mine' and ends with 'craft', most games in the craftlike genre just fail to scratch the itch the genre-setting title had left me with. I've tried dozens, and while a lot of them do build upon their own experiances and go their own ways in gameplay exploration, none have tackled what made minecraft so much fun to begin with.So I've kept my eye on this title ambiently, and only recently realized it was finally open for free players. I was excited, but having known my past experiances, I wasn't overwhelmingly hopeful. Sure it looked cute, but could it scratch the itch?Well, it did. Within the first 10min of gameplay I was thoroughly impressed. The block setup is quite familiar but as far as crafting and mining goes, it actually improves upon previous title's attempts in very intiutive and creative ways. I adore the mining nodes. I adore the crafting stations and how you can build a mixed queue. I love how the combat feels a bit MMO-y but not in a terrible way. The animal and character models do seem "out of place" depending on your opinions on graphics, but they are none the less well designed, beautifully textured and wonderfully modeled and animated.It's just a gorgerous game. And as someone who likes open world games for aesthetics, I was quite pleased with this. The trees are robust and you genuinely feel like you're in a dense forset. The other biomes, though I have yet do explore too deeply into them due to tougher mobs, are just as gorgeous.The pacing feels a bit odd, but It's tier-based as I feel a craftlike should be. In this case, there's many different layers of underground rocks and you can only progress past certain layers if you have the correct mining tier. There are some things that feel a bit odd, but because they seem more unfinished than anything. The pet system is really awesome and I look forward to tamed animals being coded to act as combat buddies and mounts (they are only livestock atm.) and the fact you can tame almost anything save for a handful of named special mobs, is fantastic.I'm genuinely looking forward to this title. I kind of wish it was a pay-for game, but I can understand their reasoning for micro transactions. And their micro transactions appear to be completely humane at this point in time as well, you are buying recipies for purely aesthetic building blocks, like tiles and carved stonework, as well as 3d blueprints to help you build a house if you're not the creative type.All in all this is pretty dang solid. Eagerly looking forward to updates!ps - I forgot to mention, this game is obviously heavily geared towards kids, but isn't dumbed down /at all/. Which makes me thrilled as an adult, and also thrilled that game companies catering to children are begining to understand kids aren't dumb as rocks and love challenges. Thank you, Playful!

content:
Posted: March 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Spiral Knights meets Minecraft. Mysticism mixes with technology as you use arcane artifacts to bend the world around you to your will.That's just the aesthetic, though. The atmosphere is spot-on, from the music (that is, I'll admit, eerily similar to Minecraft's) to the guttural growl of the Miru outside your house as you hide in the light of your moss-burning torch. An eager chase after a nearby Keepa, holder of the arcstones that make such pretty little lights. The awe and shame as you accidentally light a tarpit on fire with your torch. It's all delightful, and it reminds me why I loved playing Minecraft years ago!I'll admit I'm not very far into the game at all at this point of writing. I've only just gotten my Iron Mining Cell, but I had a heap of fun getting there with my friend. And this game is very much worth playing with friends. Perhaps while you're in voice chat, if possible?Other reviews say it as well, but this game is immensely easy to set up servers on. Just hop in game, create a world, and start inviting friends! You can even set a password.

								This game was fun for 3 days, I had a large group of my friends and we all had our own dedicated server. It had good connections and the ability for all of us to work together. We built had a lot of fun but after those 2-3 days we had unlocked just about everything in the game. We had all of the high level armour and the weapon to go along with it, we had all the potions, all of the building materials (we built the skyfort thing.) The game has so much potental but it was to easy to progress. With a super extractor you are able to get six lumite (the rarest material.) This is overpowered because you can get a full set of lumite armour only extracting 2 which is not hard to do because the dark area below  is not hard to get to or  kill the enemies. I mean this is fun but after this 3 day point the main thing i realized is that iron is harder to get than lumite. Diamond is so easily accessable you get to the level and you can get hundreds in 10 min. We also hated the fact that if you wanted a iron table you have to progress from the bottom of the list by making a wood, stone, and obsidion table just to unlock an iron table. This is bad because you are litterally wasting resources because you will throw away all of the other tables you do not need. Everything in this game requires you to progress from the bottom of a catagory even if you are well progressed overall above it. After geting armour you basically have nothing else to do with it. For example in minecraft they have enchanting and if you get a bad enchantment you have to grind out more diamonds and levels to enchant. In all, this game could be better if it was harder to progress by showing a difference in color between certain ores like obsidion and coal look practically the same, or limestone looks like every other stone in the game. Or if you nerfed the extractors so that you only get 1 lumite, take out teleporters because if you have teleporters people will again progress to quickly and be off of your game faster, make lumite generate less (like 1/100th of the spawn rate same with diamond) CREATE A PURPOSE FOR LEAVING SPAWN you can get everything to progress in spawn and the surrounding biomes, why make a map so big with no reason to explore it. Also create an endgame other than getting the armour.

content:
Posted: February 6
Early Access Review
								In short, this game's got a lot of potential, but many features are still currently under-developedThis game is a mix of Minecraft, Portal Knights, Trove and many other sandbox block building adventure games. It has good graphics and can run smoothly on machines not equipped with a graphics card (Surface Pro 4 for example). I was attracted to this game mainly questing to unlock all the crafting recipes while mining every type of ores, taming every type of animals etc.However as this is an Early Access Game, features are still rather limited. After 9-10 or so hours I have already "finished" the game (i.e Unlocked all the recipes, self sufficient with resources etc). There are literally no automation available in this game, you are required to search and dig out every single block all by yourself, and just because you have equipped a diamond glove/lumina glove doesn't mean your digging speed becomes faster either. The Pro feature of this game although doesn't make this game pay2win, its price tag makes the feature rather unattractive for myself to purchase.Do I recommend this game? Well, for now yes, as I can see there are a lot of potentials to make this game a lot better (e.g Modding, Automation, More adventures, Less Grinding etc). Finally, this game is an early access game, things are still subject to change so will this review.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL;DR : I LOVE CREATIVERSE!This game has honestly surprised me quite a bit. Within the past few years, ever since that one day in my tech class in middle school, I have been playing Minecraft (It was 6 years ago, I was in 7th/8th grade at the time). More and more that game has been releasing updates, so many that I can't keep up with, and so many that it sort of just takes away the good old nostalgic times of spending hours upon hours a day on building, mining, and surviving. I loved that game, with all that I had of me. It's been the foundation for my most precious friendship to this day. Anyways, I have had lots and lots of experience of playing Minecraft, both with friends, alone, casually, competitively, you name it. I had loved that game. Then, one day, I am scrolling through the latest and greatest f2p games here on Steam (let's be honest, alot of em are either lazy works of disappointment, or just projects that just died out.) Well, I stumbled across this game, and I've only played about 24 hours of this msaterpiece, and yet I am more impressed and captivated than I am for Minecraft anymore. Something about this game gives me a tingling in my stomach, and with all the aspects and content this game offers, it's hard to put it down. Whether it be the looting aspect as many MMO's seem to have whenever you defeated a passive or aggressive mob, or maybe it would be the amazing feeling you get when you spend hours building something that looks amazing in your head from nothing into something, with amazing ancient technology and gear to help you along the way, or even just the simple, yet beautiful, artwork. Whatever it may be, I can honestly say that this game has brought me more satisfaction and fun than Minecraft has in quite a long time. Don't get me wrong, I love Minecraft, but the way it is now will never be the same, just nostalgic dreams drifting throughoust my mind from time to time. If you are looking for a great game to both enjoy by yourself and your friends, then I would HIGHLY recommend this great game. Even if you are new to this gamestyle, it's definitely worth checking out for even just and hour or two, or maybe more ;)

number of helpful: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've played about ~20 hours or so across 2 accounts and I personally found it pretty fun and entertaining. I'm more into the exploration, mining and combat side of things rather than building although if I was I'd have gotten many many more hours out of this.It does feel very similar to Minecraft but also feels very different. The voxel (cubes) design will obviously look extremely familiar and so will some of the gameplay elements such as farming. Although in Creativerse you can do other things such as tame animals, and not only that but mining can be a little more complicated requiring different devices in order to get deeper into the earth (mining cells, basically your laser mining pick ...who doesn't like lasers?!) and then on special blocks of ore you need to use an extractor or an advanced extractor to get a higher yield, and this can take between 20 seconds and 6 minutes per block, so get ready to defend yourself or atleast don't forget where the block is!Then you have to keep an eye on things like becoming too hot, too cold, and corruption. Once these are full you will begin to take damage! There are things in place and things you can build or do to yourself to defend against this. You can use potions, a healing beacon, mineral water or just ordinary water to cool yourself off, heal yourself, warm yourself up and to cleanse corruption. I would definitely reccommend this game, for a free to play title I got a good amount of play time out of it, although it's still pretty early in development they are adding much more (hopefully more layers to the world as endgame seems a little too easy).

Early Access Review
								Actually quite fun. Smooth controls and character movement, hud is great , Music is well done & graphics are well polished . This game is a very fun , free to play "minecraft" genre game.Downsides I have found, the pay model doesn't fit for PC games. This pay for coins aspect feels like a mobile games income raking trash. That I found to be even worse than usual and this is why , when you purchase things like "Blue Prints" for different craftables you can only activate them(Use them) on one server.. So say you choose to play on a public server and spend your time on it then purchase a bp and activate it then say the server shuts down and well you have lost your Money/Coins and will need to fork up some more to get another one. That is only one example corrupt data saves etc can wreck your purchases. After doing a bit of reading seems that this has been an issue for quite awhile and after the community has pointed the dislike on the issue the dev team has discussed the issue amongst themselves and we still have single use pay model.Other than that if you want to play for free it is fun for a vanilla style minecraft experience. Also worth mentioning this game lack's the ability for  community modding.

content:
Posted: February 1
Early Access Review
								Creativerse is an Early-Access game, points made in this review might be redundant at a later date.During my first time playing, I was, somewhat, immersed with the music and nature of the game and it was truly a sight to take in, despite the blocky feel however. The controls are very simple so it's easy to get a grasp of how to navigate terrain especially with the useful compass and structure symbols that are located at the top.  Crafting can be a pain sometimes, trying to find the right resources is tricky and risky if you don't have a sword to defend yourself with against the repetitive creatures. Oh, a tip, if you just circle around them while attacking, it seems to stop them from hitting you ;) Playing with friends is a lot more fun than playing by your self and, although never really tried it myself, multiplayer seems to be a lot of fun.Now onto some negative points.Once you've crafted everything there's not a lot you can do, sure you can play with people online but there's nothing to feel any satisfaction from anything. I shouldn't have to pay just to earn the ability to make my own worlds, that's rediculous and should be a mechanic in the game already. The ability to fly? At least let people craft wings or make an item that allows the user to fly for a limited amount of time. I don't know really, it just seems a bit silly. The creatures in this game are no challenge at all after you craft a sword, they often get stuck in the terrain and sometimes are even frozen on the spot making them stupid-easy targets. (Again I understand it's an Early Access) Your tamed creatures are useless, they don't seem to attack any hostiles in the area and I just don't understand why this is in here. Sure it's cute to name your first pigsy but there's nothing to achieve from it, you either make them follow you or let them wander off. What would be cool, is if there was an option for your 'pet' to search for valuables in the area, like collecting flowers or seeds from the ground and bringing them back to you, pretty cool idea. I don't know though. I am, however, excited to see where the development leads on this. Maybe in the future, we'll see the ability to adjust the wold options without spending £/$15.00 on a upgrade just to do so. Let me know what y'all are thinking if you sat and actually read this. Have a nice day, :)

content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse! The better version of Minecraft!Creativerse is a free survival or building simulator (if thats what you can call it) and sky-rockets above Minecraft in a lot of ways.Now, before readers rush to hasty judgement, I am NOT saying Minecraft is bad. Minecraft was the spotlight of survival. But answer this: Is Minecraft really worth $20?Creativerse is free, I'm not going to put graphics into this review because who cares about graphcs? But in creativerse, it has better animation than Minecraft.-Decent animations! Enemies attack you, animals sleep, you actually look like you're putting some weight in swigning your sword-Same building style as Minecraft.-The world ADAPTS to your decisions! Thats right, the world will adapt to you! I won't spoil too much of it.-TECHNOLOGY! You don't have the same technoligical freedom Minecraft has (redstone) but Creativerse has teleporters, ark technology, and other machines. You alsohave bombs and TNT.-Multitude of enemies, the world adapts to you, which means it will introduce new enemies, as well as new enemies in different biomes.-Tamable animals. Taming animals may be a challenge, but you can tame animals as either companions or livestock, you don't KILL tamed animals, you feed them and collect their items.-There is no hunger or thirst meter, there is food though.-You cannot naturally regenerate health, you need potions or standing in w**** to restore health, this is NOT a problem, it offers a challenge.I have read several negative reviews, and yes, there is a coin shop... but I don't honestly see how this is a problem. The game needs to have support and it's not a competetive game, yes, extrating ores such as iron, coal, diamond, and obsidian does take a while. But thats why you UPGRADE YOUR TECHNOLOGY to reduce the time and obtain more ores. And also: It only takes about 2 minutes to get coal from a normal extractor. I believe the negative reviews may have overexaggerated when they said it takes "forever" for 2 minutes.And even then, the coin shop doesn't offer weapon or armour upgrades, it only offers blueprints for buildings such as castles... At least, thats all I saw.So, that was my review on Creativerse, this game has a lot to explore and many choices of build....also, there are teleporters :)

Early Access Review
								Where do i start? The beginning I think. . .Have to say, this is one of the most addictive and creative games I have ever played. There is so much to do and see, and that's just in your own world. Then there's other player worlds where you can explore and converse with fellow fans of the game and check out their creations. Some of which just blew me away. Can't wait to see what they come up with next.Thought I'd add to my review as I now have the Pro add on. Which unfortunately for the price is a bit unimpressive. I mean you can fly and you get a nifty light to help see through the darkest caves. I think one thing I do like about the pro pack is the fact you can edit your world and so make it peaceful, or spawn more loot, or even change the gravity. Apart from that, I'd hope they would of added some coins or blocks as a reward for the fee instead of making a limited time offer for free coins (which I managed to miss out on by a few days).That being said, I am still wrapped with the game and the new additions they keep bringing out on a regular basis. Which brings me to a point some of the negative reviews may have not addressed. "It's an Early Access game". Hence why it may appear somewhat vanilla as some have put it, but given a chance I believe this game will become one of the best games, if not the best game in this genre. As before, I look forward to what new surprises they drop on us.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm loving this game quite a lot, I have almost 100 hours into it at the time of writing this review. To be honest when I first seen this game (and I know i'm not the only one) I thought this was gonna be another Minecraft clone but after looking more into it and playing the game it really is a different experience overall (other than it being blocky of course), like the glove with the mining cells that's used for block placing/breaking rather than individual tools, the different types of mobs with their own unique type of attacks (wait until you meet The Thing :3), unlockable and hidden recipes for you to find, a touchstone that you can use to set your spawnpoint which i'm very glad exists considering I can get lost way too easy, not to mention you can also craft teleporters for easy travel around the world once you set them up, and I also love how easy it is to setup a server as well, literally all you have to do is just start up a world and there's your server (Passwords for worlds are optional). Those are just a few out of the many things that I love about this game.Now yes as one would expect with it being in Early Access there are some annoying bugs, like crouching not always working when moving and you end up falling off, getting stuck in stairs or roof blocks, and one rather funny bug is launching yourself forward or backward with doors if you time it just right while running into it while trying to open then quickly close it, but I can live with that as it seems like the bugs are very few in numbers that I can remember off the top of my head.Overall I highly recommend this game and this is just in Early Access too (currently on R14), who knows what will come of the game once the full release is out whenever that may be which i'm looking forward to. :)

number of helpful: 36 of 64 people (56%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I loved this game, honestly. I spent a bit of time on it. I built a couple worlds up, and I enjoyed it. I spent quite a bit of time on each one, making them all a little different, and I played with my friends in the privated worlds. Then the next update comes a bit after the Golden Age, and I see "Patch R33 Now Live!" I was pretty excited about this patch, as I already knew it would bring in new things like automation and machines. So I read through it and I saw "We've been trying to figure out a way to make this game Pay 2 Play er- I mean... Trying to figure out how to fairly charge our players, and we came up with Creativerse Pro!"Now what I SAW in the actual patch notes was, "Creativerse Pro players now will get a Glider, a Flashlight, and a bigger inventory." I didn't really care about anything except the inventory, that did tick me off a bit when I saw it. However, I could deal with it. What I COULD NOT DEAL WITH is the fact that when I booted up my game, I was restricted from touching any advanced world settings, ESPECIALLY after I was really looking forward to messing around with them because I knew that new settings were introduced in the same R33 patch. However, I still had hope for the game, because I still enjoyed it.What made me simply stop playing this game was when I tried to click "Create New World" and a pop-up advertisement shouted in my face, "BUY CREATIVERSE PRO FOR THIS FEATURE TO UNLOCK!" At that moment, I lost all hope on the game. It had now turned from a fun, enjoyable F2P game to a P2P.Point and Case, I would love to recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed crafting survival games, like Minecraft but much better, but I simply can't do that anymore.This was a great game, but DO NOT EVEN DOWNLOAD THIS GAME.It simply isn't worth downloading at this point.Save your own time, and go look for something else, because the label "Free To Play" on this game has faded away already, while still in early access, and beneath it is now "Pay To Play".[[[ EDIT: I edited it, thanks to people correcting me. I didn't realize it myself at first but P2W doesn't make much sense, it's Pay 2 Play, changes have been made accordingly.]]]

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								the game is nice. If you are artistic and want to build simular to minecraft, but prettier, it's a nice alternative. mind that the game lacks a lot of other features you find in minecraft clones (for example, redstone mechanisms), meanwhile it has a few features of it's own that are unique (like build templates).some things you should know:   you need to kill or tame monsters as you progress, you are going to have to get used to it. the best way to do this is with explosives. explosives are love, explosives are life... the sword is best for farming explosive mats from pigsies (using explosives to get mats is not efficient). or tame pigsies, and learn how to feed, and take care of them.  green goo is important for a large amount of block crafting. save these for your projects as much as you can, there is no easy way to farm these, save killing monsters. you may end up with a lot while farming for explosive mats, but you'll realize when you start building that you will never have enough goo.   when starting the game, get up into a tree and build a base there. night mobs rarely spawn on leaves. trees are also a great source of mats for building.    first objective is to collect up crafting recipes. also, openly explore, most mobs won't attack unless you attack, most. two best ways I have found for taming is stun bombs or standing on ladders, depends on what you are taming. taming is not easy otherwise. most monsters are easiest and fastest to just kill, but that uses up a large amount of explosives, taming is good for saving resources, but inversely, you will have to farm and cook for them.going to stop there, that's most of the game. building is the main objective and you have a great variety of designs to build with, I suggest sticking with lower end building materials like stone or wood though if you want to go big.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								My first day/night in Creativerse: I spawned, looked around at all the huge environment that I could see from where I was standing. The first thing I notice is the colors and well lit environment this is different than some of those other "block" games so I thought that's pretty cool. then first encounter with an animal, it was a Pigsy, then I saw a Leafi and they are just going about their business doing their thing, So I went and did mine which was mainly running, jumping, digging, making stuff (armor,weapons,food etc..) everything was great and fun, then night came. those same animals were still around but the changed colors and now their "thing" includes killing you,...SO...NOW...EVERYTHING...MUST...DIE. The game is a blast to play for ten minutes or two hours and it's not just another clone of some other game. like some people may be thinking. similar concept,...yes. but a game all it's own.and for the new pro version...it's an option. but hey who doesn't like to get paid for their work. I know I do. and if I ever think about going back to game dev, I'll probably hit them up. get the game it's free and fun even in single player like I played all 90 of my hours.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								One of the most Innovative Minecraft-Inspired games you'll ever play.While this game may still be in Early Access, the potential for Creativerse's future is absolutely astonishing.There is never a dull time while playing this game. There is always something to do, something to build, and crafting recipes to discover. The monsters are remarkably charming, derpy looking, and just fun to watch walk around (or kill). Not only that, but every monster in the game is Tamable! The art style is also one of the many fine features of Creativerse, as it's vivid bright colors and textures grasp your eyes and attention to detail. One of the most successful and brilliant features this game has to offer, is Hassle-Free server hosting; that friends and family can enter with or without you (as long as they know your password). Servers also have Claiming and Grief Prevention you can set up in your world. Lastly, player server's are 100% Company-Side Hosted and there is absolutely no lag whatsoever (unless your pc is garbage, what do you expect?). Only time your server will be offline, is during Maintenance; which usually never happens unless something needs a change or content being added to the game. Did I mention Creativerse has like, no bugs at all? It's so squeaky clean and well polished!Go play Creativerse for yourself, and see what I am talking about. Nothing says experience, like... experience? *Gets killed by a Leafi*Graphics - 10/10Gameplay - 9/10Replayability - 10/10Performance - 10/10Bugs - Practically Non-Existent

number of helpful: 32 of 57 people (56%) found this review helpful6 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm torn when it comes to reviewing this game.  I loved the first 15 hours of gameplay.  The problem is that in that 15 hours you can pretty much complete EVERYTHING the game offers.  You can go from wielding a wooden stick, to the best weapon/gear in the game with relative easy.  That wouldn't normally be an issue, if there was some reason to get those great items.  But there isn't.  There are no world bosses to prepare for... no dungeons to get stronger for... no Elite monsters to defend for.The enemy variety is terrible.  Each biome may have 1 or 2 unique enemies... but most of the enemies are just recolored skins of enemies from other biomes.  You WANT to explore the absolutely huge world, but feel like it would be a waste because, with the exception of some cool randomly generated terrains, there is nothing new or exciting around the corner.  You can travel to the other side of the world, and the caves and mining nodes are the exact same as the ones in the biomes near your base.  There is simply no reason to venture off.Now, for the building aspect of this game... it's great.  If you want to come in, and just build huge structures and houses or whatever... you have all the tools to do so.  It's fun, and there is a decent variety of materials.  The UI is reasonable, and you don't feel like it holds you back.  The one area of absolute insanity on the part of the developers is the teleporters.  You can place "beacons" around the world that you can teleport to.  Now, a normal person would think that in order to teleport to a location, you click an item, select the location you want to teleport to, then POOF!  But nope, not this game.  Here, you have to place the teleporter, and then give it a code name which you create out of building materials.  Any time you want to teleport to that location, you have to input the building materials which you code named the teleporter.  Sound confusing?  It is.Why is that a problem?  Because the game doesn't keep track of ANY of this for you.  You can have 20 teleporters across the world, and you are expected to remember the unique code combinations for all of them.  You know what that means?  I have about 17 teleporters out in the world that I will never visit again because I can't remember the code combination.  In order to make any of this function, you would need to keep a real life pen and paper list of all of your teleporters and codes.  That is such an overly complicated system.This game has been in "Early Access" for two years now.  It boggles my mind that the game was playable two years ago... and yet still only has the current level of depth to it.  You would think there would be more to do in the game if it has been in production for 3+ years.TL;DR  - Fun for the first 15 hours or so.  Then it's just a build-a-block game offering no progression for your character.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a very pretty game!  But I cannot in good faith recommend it.There are a lot of crafting options, things flow more or less understandably with the recipes being unlocked as you build things - not a huge fan of that, but it helps you understand the game so I'm alright with it.  Visually it's very nice!  But the problem is the combat system.Monsters have a much larger range than you and there are no effective ranged weapons, so I was forced to dash through enemies (there is no collision damage, the one small mercy here) while swinging and /hoping/ I hit - didn't always, because sometimes I would inexplicably fail to swing my sword for several seconds and then swipe at empty air.  And with limited stamina, every battle against an enemy that actually fights back - and all but three or four of them do - is a dice roll whether you'll be able to win before your dash meter bottoms out and you're murderized by a tiny evil piglet.There's no other tactic that seems to work, even circle strafing, as mobs seem to be able to hit you from any angle - and any elevation.  They're easily able to follow wherever you go, unless you outpace them or have a door to shut in their face, and some are small enough to slip through 1x1 gaps and terrorize you.  There's a severe disparity between monster health and damage output for the early game.  I'm not sure how it is in late game because I gave up after progressing to the obsidian tier, and that was enough of a problem as it was, requiring the consultation of a wiki to find the best places and ways to kill things and not die repeatedly.It's a shame the combat is so awful, because the rest of the game is really quite well-done - there are ladders with auto-snap, teleporters, really nice-looking decorations; you keep everything in your action bar when you die, just not your inventory; the crafting system isn't grid-based, so it doesn't feel like a direct rip of Minecraft; all these are nice things.  But ultimately, in order to progress beyond the very basic levels of interaction with the world, you have to kill things.  And that's where the game fails, and fails terribly.I wanted to like this, I really did.  But I'm not going to suffer through this horrible combat system any longer.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Early access review, close to 300hours in game.I'm don't usually do a review. However, given the latest update, I feel obligated to do a review.I played this game when it is free and since that, I got hooked up. Played this with my kids and have a lot of fun. I never played voxel games before. So, this is my first one. I have great time playing it and met a lot of cool builders. Learned a lot of design and architecture while playing the game. This couple days, there has been a lot of bad review regarding the introduction of Pro account and when we look at it closely, most of it is from player with low in game hours. This low hoours might affect their judgement.Let me tell you why, to play this game, you will grind a lot. grind to harvest blocks, to kill mobs for their drop items, to craft new blocks, items, etc. You will have to go deep down in the underground to get resources. You will need lamp / light sources for that. This new Pro feature will give you ability to have flashlight and glider. With flashlight, you will have the ability to light your way. But, it's not that bright and will only brighten few blocks away. In big cave system, you will still need to have a lot of lamp to be able to travel and mine easily. So, flashlight is nice to have. But, it doesn't change the underlying mechanism. New players who rage quit failed to see this as they don't have enough experience in the game.Glider give huge bonus for exploring new area. But, that's it. It doesn't help you build faster, since you can't build while gliding. Once you have found an area, glider will be meaningless.Another Pro bonus is an additional backpack slot. This also doesn't really affect gameplay wise. Why? 200++ in the game and we never complained. So, why rage quit when new paid feature is out with no huge difference in gameplay? It does helped mine items bigger. But, that's the benefit of Pro. You shell out money to grind less. It is also pretty common in F2P to introduce features that allow player to grind less. By having Pro, Creativerse doesn't turn into P2W. Because, you still have to grind to mine resources, to kill mobs, to craft items, to cook foods, etc.FYI, when Pro feature was announced, I already said in my head that I will get this as a way to support the developer. The same way I purchase coins, since I got the game free. Why I did this? because the game is really good. If you don't believe me, go look for youtube video. Also, if they don't release Pro account, how will they pay server bills? How will they pay their developers?Now, for anyone still undecided, go install it and have a run for a couple of hours / days. Look for free peace worlds in the world forums. Experience the game and then decide for yourself, is this game worth your time?

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Lets get this out the way Creativerse is as much a Minecraft clone with updated graphics as your going to get and it is free. Although they have recently introduced a pro model you still get alot within the free version of the game. Pro's main benefits is a flashlight to see in the dark, glider to get around and you are allowed to create multiple worlds with special customisation options. The worlds are massive so as a free player being restricted to one world should not be a problem as there is more than enough space to keep you occupied for a long time. The game for me does micro stutter and I have seen others talk about this issue but it does not detract from a fantastic game. As I said before the game is literally like minecraft, you have the different tier of mining gloves just like mining picks in minecraft. You have a good discovery method of when you create an item or pick something up you slowly expand your recipes. There are special night monsters that come out during the night and in dark places and other creatures splashed around during the day which range from friendly to aggro. You can build swords of different levels and armor just like minecraft. You can also tame the critters of the world which you feed and wash to get items from them. This allows you to create a farm full of creatures that can set to follow, stay or just wander around. You can even add hats onto them lolYou also have blueprints which are various buildable structures ranging from treehouse to forts where it basically gives you a list of ingredients and tells you where to place each block to create the final structure. You can also swap out ingredients for others if you wish to change out what it is built with and recently they introduced mechanisms that allow you to link certain items to perform set actions. For a game I expected to be rubbish I am having a ton of fun and it is a minecraft game where you do not have to worry about hosting a server as that is all hosted by the developers.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								I was suprised to find such a competent game under the layers of eye candy and MC stigma. The systems, while some are fundamentally the same as the usual suspects, have flair to them that tell you "we're not a clone but a member of the genre."First, let's get it out of the way... the way you 'mine' blocks is awesome! Who doesn't want a gravity gauntlet? Me and my son started with the 'janky house'... building from the blueprint, slowly gathering supplies and learning the basic recipes. We didn't do a whole lot of digging, just enjoyed the scenery and got use to the mechanics. This self-imposed tutorial helped us shake off the MC mindset and get primed for whatever else CV had in store for us.From there I decided I'd start my own little slice of heaven. I made it public and unlocked... a brave move for a beginner. After about 8 hours of carving my house/mine shaft out of a riverside canyon, my first random visitor popped in. He looked around, made me really nervous (especially because I had to go to work... It felt like leaving a stranger in your house...). He must not have been too impressed, as he left without doing anything and only stole some leather before placing his touchstone and going about his business. I've since edited the world to force visitors to keep their hands to themselves.. and removed his foothold, but the concept really enticed me. This is the good stuff. Having people over to help you build, help you fight, help you shape the huge worlds you've spawned. A truly exciting multiplayer experience.I'm now well on my way to unlocking the secrets that are buried deep in Creativerse. I have my diamond mining cell and some decent armor, I'm using teleporters and freezing tar. I don't exactly know what I'm working towards, but the journey is fresh and I'm racing to get there.For a F2P game, it's amazing. Anyone that likes to build or discover will love the work the devs have put in here. If you've been looking for a new way to waste a couple hundred, or thousand or hours, you've found it. Check out the discussions section for things I think should be added.. For as awesome as the game is, it has sooo much more potential!

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								NOTE: I have many hours outside of Steam, as well.Although it looks like a Minecraft rip-off on the surface, once you start playing, you'll realize that it is its own game. Not all sandbox games with squares are trying to be Minecraft.. especially this one.The Graphics: 7.5/10Yes, the graphics are really nice to look at, along with the animations. The world comes alive much more than many other games, including Minecraft. However, with all that's going on - nearly everything is animated - it can get a bit laggy. Just because your PC can run games like Grand Theft Auto V at 60 fps on high graphics, does NOT mean you can run this game on high graphics - I know this firsthand. I have all my settings set to minimal. I can barely tell the difference between max and minimum graphics visually, but it does effect my FPS. Overall, really nice graphics and animations, but it needs to be optimized for minimal lag. The UI & Controls: 9/10The user interface is fantastic all around. It isn't the same bare-bones UI you'd expect in early access game (I see you over there, ARK), but is instead detailed and elegant. It could use some improvements, sure, but for early access, the UI is really nice and self-explanatory. The controls are somewhat familiar - if you've played Minecraft, there won't be a huge learning curve. WASD and mouse buttons are the same as in Minecraft. It has more controls, actually - and it still doesn't seem overwhelming even on your first time playing. The Gameplay: 8.5/10Like most sandbox games, when you load up a world, it doesn't tell you what exactly you need to do. You start off exploring, playing with the controls, and seeing what there is to offer. Eventually, as you explore, you'll find a crafting table. Once you find that, it becomes self explanatory - find this, craft this, build this, do this.. it isn't confusing. However, don't mistake this for the game being linear. It is not linear at all - you can take your survival in many directions. Unlike many sandbox survival games, you have a single do-it-all tool that comes attatched to your character, and you simply have to upgrade it to break new types of blocks. This makes the game less confusing, but may even make it too simplistic. However, overall, the game is quite self-explanatory, but in a fun way. You won't run out of things any time soon. And if you do...The Multiplayer: Your worlds are servers. When you create a world, it becomes public on the list of worlds - people can search for the name of your world, and (try to) join it. You can password protect the world, or make it so those who join can't edit the world, but anyone can view your world by searching the name of the world. This makes multiplayer with friends extremely easy. You simply tell them the name of the world (and password, if you set one), they search it, and they can easily join. It's fantastic. There's also a wide range of administrative tools for your world, and settings to make your experience easier or more difficult.The Community: 10/10Fantastic community. The devs replied to my problems within hours, and the community was equally ready and happy to help. This is not an immature community.The problems:There is no chat in the game, even if multiple people are online in the same world. It requires a fairly updated graphics card - there's a good chance you'll need to do some updating of your drivers.It can lag, even on great PCs... needs some optimizing.I'm a little worried about it becoming free-to-play at launch. I fear the microtransactions...Overall: 8.5/1010/10 would kill leaf creatures with a twig again.
