content:
Posted: September 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Zomg I usually never write reviews.This game is Notch's worst nightmare. This game will put Minecraft at a not-so-close second.First off, let me start by pointing out the developers are very active. The game seems to be moving quickly through the development cycle and there is already a LOT to do. I can see they're just getting started, and I cannot wait until even more things are added.The art style in this game is phenomenal. There were a lot of great details thought out throughout the character art and the aesthetic of the environment. Not only is the entirety of the game breakable (i.e. Minecraft) but it's just beautiful to look at.The one thing I love most: it's difficult. Expect to go through a few worlds of just utterly failing before you get the hang of it. Don't give up; it's worth it. The fact you have to work harder for results is so much more gratifying than the instant reward of playing Minecraft. You HAVE to find shelter if you want to survive; these critters involve a fair amount of skill to kill.I've played quite a few voxel games, and other than Ace of Spades (the original), they all kinda suck. Oort was a great idea but it has since been abandoned. This is the answer to the calling for a better voxel game. Crafting is pretty unique for its genre, but it makes sense and proposes a challenge that doesn't seem over the top. You don't have to travel too far to find what you need, but obtaining it may very well be a challenge. One downside to Creativerse is that it isn't very Steam-coupled. Perhaps they intend to release this through other channels but to be honest they shouldn't. Games through steam that also house their own login/authentication system usually♥♥♥♥♥♥gamers off and cause fragmentation of stats. Please, keep it coupled, at least for users playing through steam. Keep an open mind with this one if you're skeptical. It's worth the money and honestly they'd probably do well to keep it pay-to-play. $20 might be a bit steep but there is an obvious amount of love that has been poured into this game. 5/5, will continue playing for a long time. It has definitely replaced Minecraft in my eyes.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game doesn't feel like Minecraft at all in my opinion. I'd say it's more like Starbound, whether it's in the greater variety of enemies, the crafting system, or the unbelievably awesome atmosphere it creates with the well placed music and sound cues. The difficulty curve is just sublime, in particular - it'll never force you into an area you're not ready for, and new enemies are just the right level of toughness for each layer.The only thing I find "wrong" with it is the movement, but only the momentum issues with stopping and starting, and the fact that you just tumble down a cliff even when you're not holding a movement key, but honestly, these actually just add to the realistic quality of the game.All in all, it's just brilliant, and I find myself always turning to it when I get bored of TF2 or PAYDAY 2 for a while.

content:
Posted: March 20
Early Access Review
								First off, I think the positive reviews are either made by people who dont mind being misled, or sheep. As soon as i started the game, the only thing i could see was the bottom half of the game window on the upper half of my screen. Did a search for the problem and came up with this...http://steamcommunity.com/app/280790/discussions/1/523890681413854742/....grant it, its a bit old, and to be honest i didnt pay attention to the date of the post. So anyway i created a "dummy" world to fix the screen problem. Lo and behold on a free account you can only make one world. Also you cant delete that world, nor the character you made, nor can you do much of anything. To be able to do all I just mentioned, you have to buy the $20 version.Now I have no gripe with that. These guys obviously should be paid for their work. My problem is when you advertise a free game and instead of offering a free game you offer a free demo. Thats what you have here, a demo. You cant edit any of the rules for your world. Best you can do is reset it. Which by the way does nothing for you if you created a "dummy" world.Just know what your getting into. I admit i did not research the aspects of this game enough. I also admit these guys dont make that info available on the store page.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Let me get this out of the way. You know those 12972978219847 "BLOCK THINGY" games? This is not one of them.This game is a masterpiece, and absolute gold, for playing with friends. HIGHLY reccomend, for TERRARIA lovers. It has extremely familiar exploration, Spelunking, and building elements.It's $0.  For Real. ZERO. The entire game costs you NOTHING. PRO, is WELL WORTH IT, but not needed, to enjoy the game.The only use for $$, is for optional items. Please support the developer, and this game. Get some. 150+ hours, and I'm just scratching the surface.This game has inproved by leaps and bounds, since my 1st 125hours, and I am thrilled to continue!This is not some cheap, slapped together, knock-off BLOCKTHING game. This is a legit, quality product, and you have a very solid chance of enjoying it. Looks great, runs nice, plays great. This game is a winner.Blueprints are amazing..... Even those of us, who couldn't build a BOX, like me, can build a CASTLE, thanks to Blue Prints.By Day 3, I had an ENOURMOUS Castle, nearly complete, that my girls and I, worked on together, using a Blueprint. Each of us, played on our own machine, and it worked perfectly. It took a labor of love, but, we got it done, and always knew what we needed to do, and how.YOUR WORLD IS IN THE CLOUD, so anyone you allow to access it, can access it, even when your not on. This fact, is vert important. Your world becomes a place that feels real. Where you can drop in, and discover things that your friends worked on, while you were away, or, JOIN THEM at any time. It's very very cool, and required NO SETUP.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have to admit, I've never played Minecraft, but I am familiar with the minecraft-esque genre. With that in mind and this game being F2P, it definitely exceeded my expectations. Besides it freezing on me a couple of times and all your characters being the same if you do multiplayer, creepily staring at each other and glitching in strange ways if you compare them, the game is great (no, seriously). Plus, it looks like a game that will have character customization in the future. Right? Right?The number of items and vast expanses you can find and explore are overwhelming... in a good way! There's always many things you can do--grind or don't grind. The witty comments and good art for every item make it worth it, anyway. As of now, I've only found maybe three biomes other than the starting biome and I'm still scuttling around trying to bohog all the resources that pop up in each place. And now I'm going on the hunt for the special holiday items...It's a sandbox game, so of course it comes with a lot of freedom and I like that. Freedom. I do suggest that it needs a map that expands as you explore, but the lack of a map makes it more thrilling (unless you're a nomad, because then you won't care). It also makes the teleporters (and the beacons for that matter) have a use beyond reducing travel time.Creativerse is a great way to pass the time. Even if that means throwing water on top of a mountain until the amount of ice is so much that it slides you down the mountain. Ding! Dinner's ready. Then your friend shows up in the world the next day to realize the nearby mountain has an immense icecap. Forever a memorial of your hunger.I also took a peek at some negative reviews. (Someone noted that negative reviews were being "censored" because of the helpful rating, but negative reviews are very helpful when well written and their helpful ratings aren't much different from the positive reviews... Plus, it's not censorship by steam if we're the ones voting.) One thing I noticed is the top ones are from over a year ago. But another thing I noticed is people comparing it to Minecraft and mostly complaining about waiting-times. To that, I leave you with this, because it has always confused me: When building a table, can you throw the raw materials on the ground and have the parts magically shape and form together? Does this process take a simple five minutes? Can you toss a seed onto the ground and be instantly blown away by its growth? Does it harvest itself? Do you have nothing else to do in your life but watch the table build itself or the plant grow? Like I said, this game lets you do more. So do more!

content:
Posted: April 13
Early Access Review
								To start with, I've been playing this game for a bit of time. At first, I have compared it to minecraft. A LOT. But, after I have saw the gloves, new monsters that brought in the chills I used to feel whenever exploring any other sandbox game, I started to really get into it. And I must say, it's no mere ripoff of minecraft. It let me feel the same thrill as in every single other game. Getting to know the wacky, buggy and interesting physics engine, seeing new, goofy in most cases models of players and monsters, feeling the fun of not knowing how to craft anything, killing first monsters, and getting killed by them instead, in most cases, gathering my first rescources, going mining, getting my first bits of coal, beforehand realizing i had to make extractors for that, getting my first bits of obsidian and farming then for a stone cell only to gather bedrock to make a forge. Most of the flaws of the game are not really even that bothersome. In fact, they give the game some fun tricks to pull off. Let's say the buggy physics engine, for example. Turn a chair upside down, sit on it, get off, and you're in for another Apollo space program to the skybox, after which you may or may not die. And that's what makes this game so lovable. Many goofy things in it: comedic item descriptions, silly monster design, gloves that suck up blocks for ordinary pickaxes, teleporters, ingame jokes, pretty decent terrain generation. Then, there's housebuilding. And dear lord, the amount of blocks and furniture is simply MASSIVE. I simply LOVE how much variety there is in terms of housing. Most of players may build simple wooden houses in the middle of their beloved forest. And they will look just as good as another player's treehouse. But then, it can be also beaten by some ambitious player's greek styled cave base with many fountains in it and many chamers of all kinds. That's what this game is about. The variety.But lately, suddenly something started to change. Developers seemed to have a shortage on money, and offering the pro mode, which offers some neat features such as flashlight, more backpack space or a glider, was a pretty good move, including the paid block packs and blueprints. It's all fine and is a good way to make the game more entertaining while keeping the free experience as good, except a little worse, than premium experience. Until they have started limiting some of the crucial world options, such as setting a world count cap, disabling a few options and disallowing free players to disable PVP. That is what made the players hate the developers, and is an unhealthy move. But I am not to complain about devs, but about the game.Tl;dr Game's a really cool minecraft looking sandbox, but devs turned out to be greedy and made the pro mode take away some of fun away from it. Hate the player not the game.

Early Access Review
								9.5/10 I believe there should be more ores, armor, weapons and a new biome/layer.Amor idea 1: Ruby armor, a little stronger than diamond and glows at night.Armor idea 2: Emerald armor, stronger than Lumite. Glows in the dark just like Ruby and during the daytime you get a 5+ damage increase against corrupt monsters and has a 5% armor increase towards mobs of it's own layer known as the ED layer which contains poisonous neon green monsters who glow. (Miru, Pigsy, Chizzard and Rockster) they also spit this weird green gew that does posion damage for 5 seconds. The water in this layer is neon green and glows and when you step in it, it does 8 seconds of posion damage. The blocks down there consist of Dirt, Stone, Woods, Leaves. (ED Leaves, ED Dirt, ED Stone, and ED wood. Also ED trees) Weapon idea 1: Emerald sword, does a bit more than Lumite sword and glows during the dark.Weapon idea 2: Bows. (Lumite, Wood, Diamond, Obsidian, Stone, Iron.) Ore idea 1: RubyOre idea 2: Emerald I am open to opinions on this good or bad.Emerald Sword does 10% more damage this monsters that are not ED.Emerald mining cell: Better than lumite and will lose no durability mining T1 blocks.Emerald armor is 5% stronger against non ED monsters.*Also open to edits*Emerald sword does 200 Overall emerald armor defense: 1,300Chest plate: 600Arms: 225Legs: 225Pauldron: 250(If someone feels like it they can comment how strong Ruby armor should be)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is one of my personal favorites; it's a lot of fun whether you are playing with friends or by your self as i often do when i need to relax. The building is quite nice compared to some, though it does become tedious at times when you haven't gotten to the best mining gear or if you're looking for a recipe you want but it just won't drop, but all in all not bad. Not to mention that the graphics are being upgraded all the time and recently they added new music which I enjoyed quite a lot.Many of the negative reviews will tell you that they don't like the combat or that the game isn't worth 20 dollars. True enough 20 dallors may seem a bit much however I can't really complain since I was one of the people given a free upgrade of the pro version, but honestly it doesn't add that much to the overall gameplay or experience. If want a peaceful world you can find a friendly public one if you can't change your own and the extra tools? A light which all be it helpful is unnecessary since you can just make torches and the glider... well it can get you a few extra meters but in general it's quite hard to control but it can be helpful after you have practiced with it for a far bit. Now on to the combat, yes it's a little bit slow and could be improved some here and there, but really for what it is it's pretty decent and if you move around and don't just sit there taking all the hits to your face it's relatively effective. Seriously it's first person sword swinging it's not exciting it's not ment to be all that exciting it's ment to kill whatever's attacking you. If this game was one of those rpg mmos in thrid person I could understand wanting better flasher attacks but here it's pretty much just slash till it dies and of course as i mentioned above moving around while you fight can help quite a bit. If there's low grav on the server hoping above your target and hitting it from behind will lessen your chances of getting hit.The only things i truely dislike about this game is the tendency to get extemely laggy at times and that we haven't gotten new creatures or at the very least new uses for the creatures, but i digress those sorts of things take time to add or fix and this game is still early access.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is amazing.  At first, I thought it was just a generic mix of Minecraft and Terarria, or possibley a rip-off of Trove or Cube World, but it was something new.  The game starts you off holding your hand, but then drops you off, letting you do whatever you want-  that is untill you realize that the game's combat system sucks.  Combat from the begining to the end  consists of you and the enemy wailing on eachother untill somebody falls over.  You are expected to be physicly stronger than your enemy, not smarter.  You can't even avoid and attack once you initiate combat; the enemy's attacks just go on a timer.  It woulden't be such a big problem if combat was not such a big part of the game, but it is.  That is the number one issue with this game that games like Cube World and Terarria or even Minecraft do much better.  Also, the first few days, all enemys reck house and you have NO chance of killing them.  Apart from that, the building, exploring, and FANTASTIC multiplayer system works very well, with random treasure chests and a large ammount of areas to explore.  They nailed the underground caves and different mining system, as well as crafting, which is on a timer. The game also looks great for an early access and free game being on steam for only a few days.  I give this game a 8/10 for the faulty combat, and I hope they fix this issue in the future.Amendment: Okay, they fixed the combat mechanic, but... after releasing, they added a 20 DLC that gives you a big unfair adventage, so I give the game two points for fixing combat, but take away two for the $20 DLC.

								I am pleasantly surprised by this one. content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Well set out game for the most part. Lots of options for visitors and restrictions on them if you allow them to visit your world. Building and mining is a breeze. The crafting side is well thought out and cool. The concept of when you die, the inventory you carry gets dropped and you respawn at your teleport spot is novel. The fact that a beacon can be seen where your loot was left, makes it so much easier to find your stuff and retreive it.Overall, a great game with great ideas.So far the ONLY problem i personally have had, is when i logged into my world a few days later, my house was not built as i had left it and there was a lot of resources missing that i had collected in my previous session. I had died about 7 times and had stacked the "tombstones" (they mark the spot where your loot is when you die and you can collect them) but the entire stack was gone. Presumably bugs will be addressed as they are discovered.If you like minecraft.... you will LOVE Creativerse!!!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I really like this game, and still have fun with it presently. I've never played Minecraft before, which I suppose is the obvious comparison, so I cannot comment on how alike they are. I will say that this game visually appears similar. You gather resources, craft items, farm, fight/tame creatures, and obviously build stuff. Your basic sandbox goals. The degradation of mining utensils/weapons/armor is rather frustrating, but realistic I suppose. As with all free-to-play games (they are going f2p soon), there is a transaction store. However, that said, it only consists of pay-only building blocks and things called Blueprints (basically in-game building tutorials for certain structures). I quite fancy the blueprints actually, putting one together feels like a paint-by-number or something. Pretty much, even without paying, you can get where you want to be. The only exception would be if you really really wanted some block in the store for your build. I highly recommend this game if you like sandbox construction fun. Just make sure you protect your world from trolls (which is easy to do by checking the forums). 9/10

content:
Posted: October 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I was slightly concened this would be Minecraft Lite.  But even at this early stage its so much more fun.  There are way too many things to list but I'll cover a few of the basics.Crafting is very intuitive, their unlockable recipes are a creat idea.  No more searching Wiki's for ideas, once they are unlocked, you can see what you need to craft them.The Graphics are beautiful, especially the creatures.  A little piece of me dies, everytime I kill a Leafi.  :( MIning is no longer such a chore.  Find some ore, set up an extractor, come back later and collect your goodies.Exploration is easy.  Set up a teleportation stone in your home base and never get lost again.  Build more teleporters as you traverse the globe.  Set up new bases in different Bio's and hop to them quickly and safely.If you liked Minecraft, then buy this game.  It takes a little bit of getting used to some of the slight differences, but I believe they are all for the better.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Have to recommend this game. if you like voxel sandbox games, this one has some really great mechanics.Do I want to do a Pros /cons, not really, I'll tell you what I like instead.- I love the artstyle, it's blocky enough that building is easy, but unique enough that items and creatures don't feel like they've been created just to fit the game world.- In fact creatures are all very unique, with their own loot and fighting abilities and visually very different.- I like how mining is limited by the tech level of your equipment, no way to bum rush the highest tier.- Tame any creature you see and treat it well, it will give you better drops than just killing it.- Everything takes time, so you can leave extractors mining, farms growing, processors processing, etc. and then you can come back to collect everything later or when you next pass through an area.- Teleporters really open up the options for exploring, no need to worry about trying to get back to the edge of the world, just place a teleporter and return whenever you want.- A really interesting crafting system, with recipe tiers unlocking as you craft, as well as rare recipes from drops.- Drops, one of my favourite features is that even if you have scoured the whole area around you and picked it clean, you can still get random loot chests appear and some items grow/respawn so you can always find something new.- Death is not permanent, all your items get placed in a death chest which has a beacon of light so you can find it all again when you're ready. Just finished gathering all those blocks and then you fall off a cliff, no problem, you just have to find your way back and you've not lost all those items.- there's loads of other things, but I don't want to spoil too much.It's difficult to talk about what I don't like as things may change and bugs will be probably be fixed, so I'll just say that as long as there are more of the same in future updates, then I'll continue to be happy.

								I played this game while it was free to play a while ago. And let me tell you, it was insanely...FUN!I like the way where you have to work towards getting a certain thing crafted. Such as the bungalow walls. It makes it to where you can't just search it up and then be done with it. It adds a certain level of challenge to the game where you can't just make whatever you want in one hour, like in Minecraft, or Terraria. No, no, in this game, it'll take you DAYS to complete a blueprint you get from the shop. Would I reccomend it? Definitely. You can just wait for it to be free to play for good, like I probably will due to not having much money (most of my games are gifts), or you can buy it now to support the devs. Either way, you'll be able to play a really cool game with TONS of potential.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse is an open world voxel sandbox in EARLY ACCESS. I have to keep checking to make sure it IS early access. I think a lot of players coming into this game forget that fact. You will find something very different here that is rarely seen in any genre of Early Access game.The devs at Playful polish off their newest toys well before adding them into established content. Yes there are hickups or things are found that need to be fixed, but every single time SOMEONE from Playful is on it within a few hours at most. Even on weekends. I have personally had company Reps come directly to me for a number of things. And I'm nobody. Just an avid gamer that has discovered a game that I can really let my imagination run wild in. Quite often I have SO many ideas I wander from one to the next. Too many times you are excited over an early access game and you try to get invovled but the community and company making the game do not seem invested in the concept of gaming ... FUN. You will find with Creativerse not only a community willing to share ideas, show others how something works and help each other improve your builds, but you will find that Playful is just as involved in your experience as you are. I have been with the game long enough to watch the chatter between company personnel and the player base and have seen Playful juxtapose their game concept with player suggestions and even complaints. For an early access game ... Creativerse and her makers are that long searched for jewel that once polished to the sheen you know it will be, will give you great joy for a long time to come. Thank you Playful for hours *cough* of true enjoyment. I for one can not wait to see what you have in store for us down the road. Adora Lupinatu <3

content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Even though I've only played 3 hours, it's awesome. You create your own house like Minecraft, but the building system is better. This game is 1000% better than Minecraft. You start with a stick and a unlimited grass/dirt/wood mining tool. You progress through the game by collecting stuff either by killing monsters or opening treasure chests that appear from time to time. There are mobs, but if you die you just go back to your teleport pad that you place (or should place) and that you start with.  You can go back and get the stuff from your inventory (Quick bar stays) and a Death Stone (permanent reminder of your embarrassment, which I proudly have 3 in my house). You also unlock more recipes when you craft♥♥♥♥♥♥ This game is also small in size, definitely worth a try. Overall, a very good game so far, can't wait to see what they add nex.t

content:

Early Access Review
								Really great game. Like it more than Minecraft. I love the possibility of jumping 2 blocks instead of 1, blueprints are fantastic idea and are nicely done, minions/enemies are cute but also scary when encountering them for the first time (especially The Thing) . Travelling using teleports is fantastic. No need to run for hours if you dont want to. You can play with friends right away on your own server that the games creates for you. Overall, there is big future for this game.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Creativerse, going into the game I assumed it was going to be a terrible Minecraft clone, like so many others. I was wrong. Creativerse might take place in a world made of cubes, but the graphics, gameplay, and overall feel of the game is very different. From a graphical standpoint Creativerse uses higher res textures than the pixel look of Minecraft, and even includes monsters, characters, and items that are entirely a different style from the cube based world, including the playable characters. All of the worlds in Creativerse are multiplayer. You can join and be joined by friends and strangers depending on the world and settings.Creativerse feels like a sandbox game that builds of of concepts other sandbox games has, but still manages to feel all its own. I recommend it to anyone looking for a free to play sandbox game to try. Creativerse is free on Steam now so feel free to jump in and explore, play and do whatever in Createverse.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								If your true to any Gaming Scene then i dont need to remind you about negative reviews.Do not be blinded by the reviews that tell you the game is going pay-to-win/play.  --Sure you can buy new blocks to play with but thats just Cosmetic.--Sure you can upgrade to a Pro Account Which by the way is one time,  what do you get? Flashlight, Glider, 2 free Claims, extra server. 20 inv slots... Any real gamer can bypass this with time and experience.From a developers standpoint this was a smart move.  By allowing players to freely experience the games basic functions you offer freedom to choose whether or not its worth pitching in a few bucks for more.Pay to Win/Play?  just not seeing it. About the Game,With every early access your gonna find bugs, optimization, and freeloading♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥bags posting negative reviews about a game that hasnt even finished its development.Whats important is understanding what your getting.  That is the games basic functions, meaning everything other than premium content.  (optional)Building: There are multitudes of blocks to build with.   Farm the resources upgrade your gear build new blocks.Crafting:  The crafting system is tier based.  Build one item to unlock another.  And if you cant unlock the next tier you may not have one of the resources to build it.  Find the resource and the item will unlock.   Crafting Blocks: Processor, Forge, Cooking Station. (assuming more will come)Worlds:  Every world is a persistent and globally accessed world, (or private) once you create it you have the option of setting a few modifications such as difficulty, mob awareness, gravity......  You can always delete the world if you dont want it.  Or, you can simply rename it change its description and then reset it.Land Claim: Many Many negative reviews harp on "Oh its pay to win or pay to claim"  ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T  you get 1 claim to start then you can harvest resources to claim another.  You even have the option to support the developer by purchasing Coins  which is a cash currency.  Be warned tho, the resource cost of each claim changes the more claims you have.World/Land Permissions:  You have to option to protect your world from♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥bags by defaulting new players to Visitor Status.  These players can then request (/Request) to have their status promoted (Visitor, Interact Only, Builder, Mod, Admin)  The same concept applies to Claimed Land.  The Land owner can change the player settings of every player on the server to have designated access to his or her land.Premium Content:  (if you call it that)  In any Free to Play game there will always be a way for the developer to give its players a way to support them.  In this case you can: Upgrade to a Pro Account (one time buy)  or you can purchase Coins, coins allow you the option of getting more blocks and if you wanted to, you could waste them on buy land claims.  No real reason too, since you can harvest 20 coal and purchase the next land claim that way.Overall Thoughts:   This game has come a long way from when i first played it.....(on my sons account)  Creativerse is making steady progress and i trust the developers to follow their own plans for the game.  Creativerse has a well developed Rock Solid foundation for the game to expand upon.  I dont say this often but this game is easy to come back to when you get burnt out on other games.  With more content coming and the games rapid development  I highly recommend you give it a try.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								I see a lot of people complaining about now having to spend 20$ on "Pro" Even without it you can still do a lot of things. Perhaps they are upset that they cant fly or use a flashlight? (Both which come with the pro account) I played a while without it but decided to upgrade to help support the game.As people have said, Creativerse is a lot like minecraft. It's also a lot more though. Instead of crafting normal tools such as a pickaxe or an axe you make cells. Each one helps you dig further and further into the ground until you come to the final "layer".You unlock recepie's by crafting other items. (Make a wooden fence and you unlock wooden gate and stone fence for example.)Instead of cows, pigs and sheep you have weird monster like creatures that you can tame. Once you feed them they will produce items which you harvest with your cell. Then you must bathe them. Rinse and repeat.Of course, like many newer games there are a few bugs. You need to keep your tamed monsters in the stay position. If you let them wander they may dissappear for good.I would give this game an 8.5 out of ten. I look foreward to more updates in the future.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a first for me doing a review, well this is going to be more of a first impressions during the first 24 hrs of game play.First the visuals are very pleasing graphics are nice and well done and so far i haven't seen any re-colouring to create different areas.Game play is nice and fluid some of the creature movement can be a little buggy but nothing game breaking but its early days.The crafting system is very well done i like the progression craft to learn new upgraded items and also the chance that recipes can drop from chests and mob loot.Building is very much like other games of the same genre.The mobs are well done with a great art style some cute some goofy looking and then there are the menacing ones.So far i have found the world to be rather large and haven't found an end to it as yet, having vines hanging from trees that you can climb is a nice touch and being able to tree hop is different, digging down  is a fun task and I`ve found can take some time as you need to upgrade your mining glove to be able to dig deeper and i got to the cursed layer late last night.Environment effects i had mixed feelings about this but they add another element and sometimes a sense of urgency to get the hell out quickly, as i said being on the cursed layer i had a  cursed and a heat debuff ticking away( and yes there are potions you can craft to to keep these at bay).Over all the game is very pleasing and a lot of fun to play i am looking forward to what will be next and I`m very impressed with what they have done so far.Devs listen and are also very active in the forums from what i have seen, there has been talk about Creativerse going F2P many don't like the idea but there a many that also welcome it, i purchased this on sale i paid i think $13 but would happily pay $20 .I hope to add more to this as time goes on and I would suggest to grab it while its on sale  as there is a whole lot of fun to be had .

number of helpful: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								Don't knock this off as some clone. Oh, no, Creativerse is something grand in the making.It feels as though the creators of Minecraft listened to every whispered complaint and then, BAM, Creativerse was born. It's (almost) everything you loved about Minecraft with better grapghics, and a more laidback, sci-fi atmosphere.Creativerse gives you:-Bigger pet selection (every monster is tameable)-Pets pay out (you get items for caring for these buggers)-Better water graphics (Physics? Not so much...)-Adorable pre-teen characters (though I wish you could change their appearance. Oh well, maybe in an update.)-No Creepers! (huge plus for me. No random, hard-work-destroying explosions)-Sci-fi atmosphere (Suck-arms instead of pickaxes and glowy machinery for crafting)-Teleportation (makes life easy. You can recall to wherever you place your pad using the 'T' shortcut OR create a numbetr of teleporters you can step through and link together via a nifty little menu where you place items inside it to attune them to one another)-Easy to navigate U.I. (Very intuitive. Bonus: almost all of the items you can interact with can be renamed) -Dungeoning (Plenty of monsters and dark pits to wander through with a torch, though the equipment selection feels a little sparce thus far)-It's now FREE TO PLAY. -Did I mention it's free?So, yes, it draws a lot of inspiration from Minecraft, but it's definitely not a carbon copy. Definitely worth a play. Creativerse is far from perfect, but I'm looking forward to what future updates hold.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								I don't like Minecraft, but I love this game.  305 hours and it is still as fun as it was back when I bought it.  Now it is free, MT for block kits and coins which you can use to buy custom blocks.  You can still make anything you want without buying anything.  However you can assemble blueprints quickly by buying the block kits that include all the blocks you need to complete the blueprint.You used to have to spend coins on the blueprints but they are all craftable now.  You basically gather some blocks and create the blueprint, set that down and then build the structure.  Some of the blueprints contains over 10,000 blocks!  Will keep you going for some time :)  You can also customize the blueprints.  For instance if you decide to build the wood fort but want to make it out of rock you can customize the blueprint and replace the wood blocks with the stone of your choice.  It will update the blueprint and tell you where those blocks go.  Pretty cool.Overall I'd recommend this game.  I mean hey it's free, what have you got to lose?

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Honestly, it didn't start well. I tried it during the free week, and from what I've read about it, it was a Minecraft clone with paying Early Access that would be released later as a free-to-play game with cash shop.Starting with the cons :After some hours I found out about the waiting game : want to convert some blocks into crafting materials ? You have to wait for a "processor" to do it. Want to extract coal, obsidian and iron ? You have to wait. And the more precious the material is, the longer you wait.Also, you need to craft specific mining cells to gather blocks, one for each "level" ( stone, fossil, lava, etc. ), and each cell only permits you to gather a few hundreds blocks maybe, so you need to craft a new one every 2 minutes; And gathering the materials to craft those cells can be really boring, especially the flowers that grow on trees ( but there is an exploit you can use to get tons of them, even the devs suggest that you use it )...All of this just screams "we're gonna make you pay to wait less, like any stupid facebook game", doesn't it ?Something baffling too is that there is no portable light, so you have to waste a lot of ressources crafting torches or lanterns, or waste your time picking them up to place them elsewhere. And as their radius is REALLY small, you'll need hundreds of them...There is also this stupid "super jump bug" people have been complaining since 2014. basically, sometimes when you jump your character will jump 50m high or more, and of course when you hit the ground again, you die, losing all your inventory...Last thing, it's about the monsters. They are EVERYWHERE ! You just can't dig anywhere without stumbling into a cave full of mobs. It's not really a problem in itself, the real problem is the sound : you will hear those monsters through the walls all the time, because no matter where you try to build your house, there will be a cave nearby. I've spend hours filling a entire cave with blocks to keep monsters from spawning under my castle, so I wouldn't have to hear them.Now the pros, and why I finally bought the game and recommend it :Well first, the devs put it for free for a week, so they are pretty confident with their product and know it's good.After the bad first impression with the waiting game, I kept playing, more and more. And the game itself is good. I never played Minecraft so I can't compare, but I played Terraria and Starbound, and I really prefer Creativerse.Sure you have to wait to craft materials, but you just need to craft several crafting stations to speed up the process. Sure you need to wait to gather ore, but you can just put an extractor on the node and keep digging around, then come back later to gather the ore. In the end it's no big deal, if it stays that way.It's still EA but the game feels finished, except for some bugs and poor performances most of the time ( don't know if it's a GPU, CPU or server lag issue, but I don't think it's because of my PC, I have a gtx970 and an i7 ).There are really nice features, one of my favorite being "TNT digging", and you can also craft a device that just removes a big square chunck of blocks, it's really quick. You can also craft teleporters and configure them with "codes" by putting 3 objects to create the code; So let's say a TP has 3 stone blocks as code, and you build another TP, you put three stone blocks as destination and BAM, you're teleported to the first one. So you can really create a whole network of TP to fast travel anywhere, like, one TP on a beach to gather seashells, another one in the snow if you need snow or ice, etc.Exploration is really nice, the world is big and full of different biomes. Caves can be really huge and take hours to explore, the atmosphere is really well done. Too bad we need so much torches to light up the path, because it's mostly pitch black, with ony some colored fog to highlight the cave at a distance.Objects and monsters design are nice too, and most textures are pretty good. However I find the building materials textures a bit ugly most of the time and it's hard to build something that looks good. I thought building an obsidian temple would look good, but in the end it's just a big, blocky, blue house...Also the character can rust fast and jump high, controls are good too, and for once the UI and inventory are pretty effective ( compared to Terraria which was a nightmare to play ).All this makes a rather enjoyable experience, so if you're looking for an almost finsihed game, just buy it. Or wait for it to be free to play and possibly destroyed by a sh*tty buisness model ( hope it won't be though ).

number of helpful: 31 of 60 people (52%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								Right, I've tried to like this game. I've got a significant playtime on a server with friends. I'm being as unbiased as I can. If Minecraft didn't exist, perhaps Creativerse would look better. As it is, by basing so much of its core gameplay off of Minecraft, it really has no excuse to be this mediocre. This game is Minecraft Lite. It's Minecraft made simple, with a lot of pretty blocks and cute "pets", but basically nothing more. It's Minecraft for the unambitious, the unimaginative. It's what you'd let your child play, if you thought she couldn't handle challenge or failure. In the process of lowering the learning curve, Creativerse takes away the cool toys and leaves you with limits. No complicated redstone, instead have a wiring system that gets confused when you send two inputs into an object. No world-manipulation capabilities like pistons or dispensers; instead have logic gates made for you as individual blocks, and only the ability to turn off lights and open doors with wiring. No large-scale crop and animal farming, instead mine every individual crop. Instead, feed/wash/harvest every individual animal, which you must also tame individually as it tries to escape or kill you. No risky death where your inventory falls into lava, instead respawn on this Touchstone, which you can reclaim from anywhere in the world, place anywhere, and teleport to anytime.Redstone and world-manipulation was the lifeblood of Minecraft; the ability to change every block of the world was one thing, but the ability to make the world change at the push of a button, to imagine contraptions and make them so, that is why Minecraft is timeless and so full of potential. There is no potential in Creativerse. The game-makers think for you, and the player is limited by the makers' imagination as a result. Hell, there isn't even rails or minecarts. "Early Access" is no excuse. In the time that this game has been in development, Minecraft went from Alpha to retail, complete with all of the core gameplay that gave the player so many possibilities. Creativerse can't add more fundamental gameplay aspects without overhauling the game, so the future will likely bring only more pretty blocks and cute pets and nothing else.In other words, if you've experienced half of what Minecraft allows you to do, then this game will make you very sad.

The standard items you can build look decent enough. You can also go to the store and purchase more items such as fansy blocks and blue prints to create better looking stuff. Over time more items are to be added in. Right now it's a small selection. They also give you a small stipend so you can get a few things off the bat.

content:
Posted: January 29
Early Access Review
								Controller Support required! I get the whole PC elite master race thing. But when you want have four friends over I would much prefer for gamepads on a couch over finding space for four computers, mice, and keyboards. Accessibility is critical, especially since it has an art direction aimed at a younger audience. This game is a good tool for groups to orgnize community gardens, farms, landscaping, architecture and other collaborative projects. Make it easily accessible. Make it a game, and a tool.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19
Early Access Review
								Creativerse is a game that has a lot of potential. Whilst games like Minecraft have a lot more features, and you can add mods, Creativerse is still in Early Access, and I have no doubt that those features will come in time. I was impressed by the variety of blocks that were available in this game, that it includes blocks to build proper houses, and that so many of the different blocks of the game have their own style of stairs/rooves/doors. It's an area where Minecraft fails, because you still have to make your rooves out of stair blocks and have only released more than 2 doors in the last few updates.At the moment Creativerse is a little empty. You can unlock 90% of all the blocks, weapons, and tools within a few hours of playing, and there's only a handful of biomes to explore and monsters to kill. It's a game with a lot of room for expansion. However, based on the more dangerous areas of the game to go in, I wouldn't say greater and grander expansions are too far down the line.Considering this game is free as well, I'd say it's definitely worth getting. If you're unsure, keep an eye on it. I suspect it'll get a lot better in the coming months.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse shows so much potential, though it's basically an FTP version of minecraft, it's a lot more detailed and more fun than most minecraft copies that I've seen. The only problem that I can see is the fact that it's online only, which I don't have a problem with personally, but it does create a problem for those who travel a lot or those who don't have a very stable connection. A few suggestions for Playful is basically add in workshop support, so that users can share their worlds and creations, or at least add in support for servers so that we don't always have to play with friends. Another thing you guys could add would be something like Minecrafts Creative mode, for those who don't prefer survival, and maybe a mode that adds in hunger, deletion of all items upon death, and the need to sleep for those who enjoy a more hardcore play through. All and all, Creativerse is a great game, I definately recommend it to those who enjoy sandbox style games.

								When my boyfriend suggested this game, I took a look at the screenshots and was a little bit surprised that he would suggest something so \"cute\" and sceptical of how much fun this would be. Upon first delving into my own world I thought \"Okay, it\'s minecraft\" but I soon found out that it\'s so much deeper, and much more fun than minecraft. I can not recommend this game highly enough (if you\'re into the genre).This early access game is definitely on its way to being one of my favourites! Great job, devs!It\'s also free, so if you try it and don\'t love it, you\'re not losing anything! What are you waiting for? just try it already!

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse shows so much potential, though it's basically an FTP version of minecraft, it's a lot more detailed and more fun than most minecraft copies that I've seen. The only problem that I can see is the fact that it's online only, which I don't have a problem with personally, but it does create a problem for those who travel a lot or those who don't have a very stable connection. A few suggestions for Playful is basically add in workshop support, so that users can share their worlds and creations, or at least add in support for servers so that we don't always have to play with friends. Another thing you guys could add would be something like Minecrafts Creative mode, for those who don't prefer survival, and maybe a mode that adds in hunger, deletion of all items upon death, and the need to sleep for those who enjoy a more hardcore play through. All and all, Creativerse is a great game, I definately recommend it to those who enjoy sandbox style games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Although this game may seem very similar to the popular game "Minecraft" there are very many differences that need to be taken into account. I just started playing Creativerse and have been almost instantaniously gripped to it. It's an awesome game to play with friends. Seeing as Creativerse is still in "Early Access" I am looking forward to what the creators have in stock for the players. There is always something that draws you and makes you want to keep playing. The feeling of killing a monster you haven't encountered before and seeing what it drops is one that I don't really see in other games. This game is unique and is highly commendable. It deserves to start off with a bang. I honestly am very excited and have great anticipation for the future of Creativerse. I strongly recommend getting it. Props to the creators. I will leave the rest for you as the reader to figure out yourself whether this is the game for you or not. Personally, as stated many times, it is the game for me.

Posted: May 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								7.5/10There’s really not much to say about this game. If you really want to play Minecraft but don’t want to pay for it, get this.It’s a good solid free-to-play game.Its crafting system is detailed. It has a more realistic, cartoony style than Minecraft and for being a free game, it’s really well done. There are creatures to fight, things to build, mines to mine. It’s pretty much a simplified version of the game everyone already knows about. It's also boring and repetitive if you're playing by yourself. But the same can be true for the original game. The best way to play this is with your friends. So gather them up and see how much chaos you can cause each other.

Early Access Review
								TL\DR : I love this game, just download it and try it already.  No PTW. Great community. Small download.  Why have you not downloaded it?Another update is here today. New models for some of the items and the characters, lots of improvements and some new bugs.  Thankfully, with all releases there is a pinned thread for new bugs.  The devs where quick to respond, wich make me feel like they were all actively waiting for feedback. I have faith they will work hard to quash those bugs to keep the game getting better and better.With this release they also adressed three of the major concerns from players feedback, keep up the great work guys :)(I have not receive any incentive other then the free game... actually, I paid for some blocks that are on sale right now)NB : An archive of my reviews can be found in this guide. Early Access Review
								For starters, yes, this game is obviously inspired by Minecraft as are many others. However, everything the developers pulled off, they pulled off just right. I stopped playing MC a couple years ago, but thought I'd give this a try. It's a suprisingly fresh take on the voxel-sandbox styled world games that keep coming out. They took all the best things people liked about MC, improved and expanded on them, whilst removing the features I don't think most people were ever really fond of in MC. Overall, it's a great game, I'd easily recommend it, and am excited to see what the developers do with this great game.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Excellent game... and is truly free!  There are a few microtransactions but they are just simple cosmetic blocks and some blueprints for people that are not really interested in creating builds themselves(which does not make a lot of sense considering that at least half the game is about building).As an avid sandbox fan, including years spent playing that other big block building game and many other sandbox/simulation games, I have waded through the trash pile of clones and wannabes for a long time, hoping to find viable alternatives... I found that with Creativerse!This game is different enough to make it stand out.  The graphics are superb, gameplay is smooth, mechanics are intuitive, crafting is simple and progression based.  You can make progression easy on yourself by making use of many mechanics for easier mob killing, or skip all of that and dive in with nothing but the clothes on your back and a wooden stick for protection.The pet taming system is great and the animations are cute and smooth... well done!Playing with your friends is super easy and quick to set up.The only negatives are the little early access bugs that sometimes annoy but nothing is game breaking or outside of acceptable EA norms... I have experienced many more frustrating bugs with finished games than are present in this already very polished game.I would love to see more mobs, machines and blocks of course, but no matter how many they implement, I am sure everyone will always welcome more of those things.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2
Early Access Review
								My computer is a potato, and somehow the game doesn't torture my FPS. Most of the time. This allows people with old computers to play the game fairly well.I feel like crafting is a bit hard, however. It took me 4 in-game days to get a furnace for some melted beeswax to get a wooden floor so I could make a stone floor, but I ended up finding a chest with the wax instead. Speaking of which, the chests are a nice addition. Maybe put some underground and add maps to find them? Thats a good idea for me.The attempt to find nodes was either a journey that would take you through 10+ areas or you spawn fairly close to one. It was SO difficult for me to find coal nodes. COAL nodes. And I only get 6 and the machine used to get the coal dissapeared. I'm not saying nodes should appear more, but nodes should appear a BIT more. That would be nice.I still reccomend the game. The creatures are nice, building is nice. This is pretty much just Minecraft mixed with Terraria, with a bit of TerraTech. All 3 cool and awesome games, and the devs decided to be geniuses and make THIS game.10/10, would commit mass Leafi genocide again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a game that my entire family has enjoyed a lot, age 7 to 40. One is a player that prefers to start at scratch on new worlds all the time, fighting mobs and getting resources while building shelters and other things. Another is an explorer, wandering all over the map, a magpie (ooooh, look, shinies!), farmer and a tamer of wild animals, and the third is a crafter and the builder of entire towns, and so on. And we love playing it together, building things together, cooperating, saving each other, finding materials for each other. I recommend this game so much, and I was rather flabbergasted by finding out how good a game this was after finding it for free on early access. You can make  a world yourself, visit other worlds, invite others into your worlds or keep everything you do entirely private - and you can decide the settings on your world; if the animals are hostile or friendly, if you can carry recipes you've learned earlier over to the new world, if explosions and bombs are usable, etc, it caters to a lot of different kind of players. Also, one of our family was a bit hesitant, not wanting to play "cube worlds that looks bad" but the tune changed when seeing how it all looks in game. It has the cube materials, but the animals, players, furniture, etc are not, and everything looks good, new and modern - and like a game of today. It is still in development, and we get nice new features and materials at pretty steady intervals, and even if you sometimes have to create a new world (the old ones are kept however many new you make) to make a new feature work, they haven't wiped the game since very early development, and many "old" worlds are still active. It takes a few minutes of figuring out what the processor and forge can do for you and how to get new things to craft in your menu, and then you're off on an adventure. The game has added a tutorial when you start the game so you get hints of what you should start doing, but the game is very intuitive. Just remember that a shelter doesn't need to be more than a few blocks of dirt and grass if you start out in hostile world the first time you play. The community is helpful, and the developers are hanging around. And there's plenty of open worlds that will help you out in figuring out things if you prefer to get your help "live" instead of posting. And it won't take long before you're running after Keepa's to tame them so you can harvest goodies regularly, shout happily when you find a node of something you've been needing for the next level cell or find a new fancy recipe in a night treasure chest. This is a nice open game that you never really finish with, there is no end game other than finding all the recipes and materials in the different layers. But don't be surprised if you find yourself building yet ANOTHER great thing some months from now, as you learn the tips and tricks in how to make the best, funniest, cleverest and most astonishing buildings!

content:
Posted: February 26
Early Access Review
								This game has the most potential out of any early access game I have played. It is basically Ultra Modded Minecraft. Myself being a Minecraft Veteran (not exactly something to be proud of) I can say this game is the ultimate Modded Minecraft. With high resolution textures and most mobs being HD models this game is, in my opinion, better than Modded Minecraft. It has in depth crafting and makes you adventure to get the materials to craft things to progress which gives the game a really nice open world to adventure in and explore. But if you want to enjoy this game to the fullest I suggest playing with friends. It overall makes the game more enjoyable and practicle since each player gets a free teleporter that anyone can use. A negative is that some really cool things in the game such as wings that allow you to fly are only accessable by buying in in app purchase for 19.99 but the game can still be enjoyed without payingOverall I give this game a 9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 11
Early Access Review
								Date of Review: 02/11/2017Score Total: 9.7/10Graphics: 7.5/10Mechanics/Gameplay: 9/10I'm legitmentaly surprised with this game. I refused to play it for the longest time because I figured it was just another minecraft ripoff. Well here's the big deal:No there's no mods.No there's no hackers. (I've looked thoroughly for hacks)Here's what's amazing about both of these. In minecraft you need all these mods and so on just to make the game look cool or decent to your tastes and those tastes hit home on your PC and/or laptop hard. This game runs smoothly, really smoothly there's some moment of minor lag (a lot to be honest) but it's incredibly small and not an issue (at least for me.) In minecraft if you want to travel faster you're screwed from the start to grind into things less you go the cheap way with a mod or two. Here, I haven't even gotten passed Iron ore and I can actually make teleporters. The ability to traverse land is amazing because of this, and if you buy the pro pack like I did, and I HIGHLY recommend it. If not for the glider, for the transportation ease, for the extra stamina, even bag space.. Just go for travel luxury. The map isn't procedurial generated. It's not as massive as Planetside 2 or Minecraft. But it IS HUGE. It'll take you the better part of an hour to get from edge to edge.Biomes, diversity in mobs and difficulty curves to match, the feeling that you don't have to walk from edge to edge but can fast travel in teleporters. The game real has a lot of potential and is hitting home runs on everything. The game has a fair community, not a big one by any means. But they're there, 24/7 too and playing this game really stimulates you. It's minecraft on hard and easy mode. The mobs keep you on your toes, the progression system is absolutely brilliant and scales you into horror. Got a pickaxe that's stone, congratz you can mine up into the next level no further. That simple stopping point is epic. It stops people from going in over their heads, being smart and gearing up for every mine shaft and cave they venture into. This game knows how to keep you on edge.Extremely recommended!

content:
Posted: November 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								So, while I could not get the full enjoyment out of the game for my multiplayer experience, I will start off by saying this is a wonderfully designed game by appearance. The interface to create and learn recipes is great for single player experiences. Looting and interacting with the world is quite nice. Even the idea of server hosted worlds right out of the box is awesome! But that lead to my major gripe, and what ultimately lead to me ceasing to play the game with my friends. Random world resets, usually via one player crashing, are the biggest annoyance I had. After playing for about a half an hour, we would have established a nice place, storage and what not. Then at least one of us crashed. Those that did, came back to the world to see everything we built and removed from the world restored to how it was when we first found it. They could 'fly' through walls and the floor as if there was no clipping on them, only because in their game, the entire structure didn't exist anymore. If they were to extract the blocks in their way, which were part of the structure in our 'version', they would receive the material as they saw it, but we would see that crafted item be picked up, and effectively deleted due to them getting 'dirt' instead.To alleviate this, those that could see packed up the base and moved to a new location, till the issue repeated. You can only be willing to rebuild/redesign a structure so many times before you just give up. Ultimately, I assume this issue comes from world data being saved on the users pc, and not coinciding/refreshing based on the severs data. At least a debug tool which forces a refresh of currently loaded cells/chunks to be downloaded from the server would be useful until this issue is fixed. But until that time, I will await for updates and play other games. Once again, the game is amazing at what it has so far, but that issue is killer for anyone hoping for a solid multiplayer experience.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse = Addiction    Creativerse = aDICtion     Creativerse = Addiction Yes. You simply become aDICted                                                                                                                       (Minecraft + Cocaine = Creativerse)Action. Adventure, a touch of pixie dust. In this utopian world where NO is not an exception or an answer. Well at least in my world *Grins* A game for those lil turkey fillets out there who love using their initiative and generally like building stuff. Graphic wise the game is quite beautiful, and each entity looks nice and cartoon like. During the day entities generally look cute, but at night they change into more ferocious entities that are aggressive in nature.It is always refreshing to play. *Coughs* One simply cannot get bored this easily This 'game' truly is an artistic masterpiece. The beautiful instrumental soundtrack, composed by the talented David Chow, specifically for this game, has a tranquil, soothing vibe that really adds to the feel of the ‘story’, that is yet to be explored. On second thought, kind of makes me feel sleepy but that depends you know… *Grins* Curiosity grows with each passing second, minute and hour. Your set to go on a relaxing and encapsulating experience begins here!My VerDICt to peasants:Score: 9/10 – If it wasn’t bugged that isssssssssssssssssssss, > I LOST EVERYTHING I BUILT< and then I would find it again and then it would disappear. Hey! And then I…Hey! Would find… Hey hey hey! I’m NOT playing hide and seek now. *clicks finger while flipping hair to the side* It played me numerous times, yet I crawled back to its hole and when sense knocked into my head I decided I wasn’t going to play it :D. *Bites lip*                                                                                                                                                                                  Get it sorted! -Even the peasants have something to say!- *Winks**Hops along to grab my choco bar*

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								Honestly, creativerse is flat out awesome. Most people say it just looks like minecraft, so theyd rather go play minecraft. WRONG. Sure it has taken a bit of inspiration from games like minecraft, but the game itself is nowhere near, the game has much to offer such as taming monsters, animals, throwing goo at your friends, mining, building, and so much more! It has a full on create-a-server with friend able to join you, descriptions and just flat out awesomeness! I have already created 4 different worlds just because its that fun!A few things though....There is no main purpose to the game, nothing to lead up to. Its just a upgrade and have fun game. (Not saying that it is bad but it could be better)Maybe as a suggestion add a Main Boss or atleast a few Mini bosses to have a goal of defeating, The "Thing"(Hardest mob i have found) Is not much of a challenge when you can get it suck, tame it and just dismiss it. Fun game overall 9/10P.S. Watch out for Hot Foots, they suck ):

content:
Posted: February 26
Early Access Review
								This game has the most potential out of any early access game I have played. It is basically Ultra Modded Minecraft. Myself being a Minecraft Veteran (not exactly something to be proud of) I can say this game is the ultimate Modded Minecraft. With high resolution textures and most mobs being HD models this game is, in my opinion, better than Modded Minecraft. It has in depth crafting and makes you adventure to get the materials to craft things to progress which gives the game a really nice open world to adventure in and explore. But if you want to enjoy this game to the fullest I suggest playing with friends. It overall makes the game more enjoyable and practicle since each player gets a free teleporter that anyone can use. A negative is that some really cool things in the game such as wings that allow you to fly are only accessable by buying in in app purchase for 19.99 but the game can still be enjoyed without payingOverall I give this game a 9/10

Early Access Review
								Creativerse...I thought I should atleast write a review about the core of this game. This game is definately drifferent but like features of Minecraft. Another form of explaining this is Minecraft is for younger generations who don't want a challange where here is a challange! The music oh my god it's not annoying like minecraft! number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is absolutely amazing! Do not think of it as a Minecraft clone, I would say it's better than minecraft in the survival department, there is no creative mode though, You can turn on special settings for your world to make it really easy to gather resources and build though. Every time that you create a world a server is created, this makes it really easy to let your friends play with you, just give them the password and name of your world and they can play with you. the combat in this game is also really great, you can't just click a few times in front of an enemy and kill them, you have to jump and dodge the enemy's attacks as well as striking blows at their back, this game also has a lot of value in its free to play package with many blocks, crafting machines, weapons, tools, enemies, areas, and resources to keep with you or in storage. Creativerse also runs very well, I have 4 GB of RAM and the game only has a few moments when it lags, those moments are during world generation, if you have a beast PC you could run this game smooth as butter on high settings. Overall, this is the most fun survival sandbox game I have ever played. PS, the game has a great community as well

content:
Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								As a long time Minecrafter I kinda think of this as it's slightly fancier more challenging cousin lol The basic concept of grab blocks,place blocks applies, day-night cycle of yay and sheer terror applies,though some of the monsters in this gae far surpass Minecraft in fear factor. The crafting though is a hyper improved system of "Craft this and oh look you can now make this"  kinda pushing you to upgrade and find new types of blocks. The biomes also feel simply...more appropriate in Creativerse,often seeing similar creatures but ones fitting for that zone in color or style.  I enjoy both but I will say this is free,the pro version may be an option someday for the cosmetics but if your looking for a fun,thinkers,building game that's free look no further! Also side note i'll be starting a Creativerse series on my youtube channel soon,so there's that XD

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								So where to begin, this game is good and has some good concepts and designs. The graphics are very visually pleasing and the game runs smooth, minus some rendering issues now and then. There is a good baseline of items that can be used, however apart from the blocks, all the items can be aquired fairly quickly. I have played this game for about 15 hours in total and pretty much have every item, minus all block colours and combinations. which really isnt long time get to end game items.As this game will be closely compared to minecraft, for obvious reasons. Although the content is lacking in creativerse in time they would be able to compete with them, such as a redstone equivalent.The biggest problem with this game is the fact that blocks can take forever to create, using forging rather than crafting. As this game has some very visually pleasuring content for structures, this should be addressed so people can come into the game and just 'CREATE', something like a creative-mode, would suit this game very well.Overall the way the game stands i would give this game a 6.5/10 and would recommend it to someone who would like a change from minecraft.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								In my books, this is the best voxel sandbox-game up until today:- Good Graphics, vibrant colors, cartoonish- Cool game mechanics (rotate blocks, gliders, gravity settings, blueprints, machines, etc.)- Best community i've ever seen so far (great support  from the devs, competitions organised by players, guides, ideas and suggestions posted by players and turned into reality by the devs)- So far every update improved the game even more (unlike other f2p games that usualy take a turn for the worse really quick), with bug fixes, added content and cool events.I highly recommend this game.Keep up with the good work!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								A fun and engaging game with lots of possibilities. Even though it is still in Early Access, and is set to be free to play once it launches, I have not regretted spending money on it, as I have had my money's worth of entertainment. Build, explore, farm and have fun! Even though I do not like comparing it to Minecraft, there really is no way to avoid it. If you enjoyed Minecraft, you should check out Creativerse. It is Minecraft with a lot more atmosphere and style, and even though the voxel-gameplay-building is similar, it just feels like Creativerse has an extra punch to it.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								So I found this game and...It's like minecraft and trove together, in a good way. So after a few hours of gameplay I can state the followings:    1. The game is under development, and it needs patches here and there.    2. The controlls in the game are simple, the movements and actions are smooth, the PvE combat is acceptable.    3. I love the idea behind the game: every map is a multiplayer server too (as long as it works its awesome!)    4. Truly free gameplay money is only for supporting (at least now)    5. Is an enjoyable game so farSo if you've read this far, and you like Minecraft and/or any similar game you should give this a try too! But don't take is as the full experience and please look back when the game is finished!

content:
Posted: October 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								I played the demo version for 6 straight hours before purchasing the game.  I own just about every sandbox game.  So far this is my favorite.  I much prefer the crafting and the harvesting.  The graphics are impressive.  I hope someday it will have the ability for you to put your own textures in the game like in minecraft... to make it more personal.  I found myself immersed into the gameplay very quickly.  Having the demo is a very good idea, I myself have a few games that became "bricks" when the designers gave up on the game.  It makes me much more cautious when buying another early access game, but it becomes less important when you really love the game.  Of course, please continue with the game :) I will be happy with every update... I love the game.  Did I mention? I love the game

Early Access Review
								I've enjoyed Creativerse quite a bit. From earning my way to newer and better recipes to actually having to go above ground for some materials, it's kept me hooked. I also like the free servers and that you can set your world to just people you want to have in it--via password. I hope the free servers stick around and that when it goes to F2P the microtransactions don't hinder actual gameplay. This is a great game now and can only keep going I think.  Keep up the good work Playful Corporation!

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?“During the first 15 months of Creativerse’s life, we charged $20 for the game. This allowed us to restrict its audience at a time when we weren’t quite ready for an influx of players. However, we always planned to make the game free as it’s our belief that this will allow us to reach the widest audience possible. Continued development is now being supported by microtransactions. We are making every effort to ensure that in-game purchases are not tied to the core loop of the game -- we want players to enjoy the game without being restricted by any pay-to-win or pay-to-play mechanics.”lies

content:
Posted: November 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								I was pleasantly surprised when I started playing. I was genuinely not expecting a good experience due to past bad lucks with free-to-play-minecraftish-sandbox of the style, but Creativerse stunned me by being IT'S OWN GAME, and not just a mincecraft clone. Despite the lack of blocking during combat, and the need of more variation in biomes and monsters (simply have two or three models for each monsters with texture variants would help.), the principle behind it all is amazingly well executed.Up to now, one of the most robust early access indie games I've got to play in a long time.EDIT:While I still give this a thumbs up, the lack of frequent and robust updates drove me off. Once you hit the end-game content, there isn't much left to do other than to build whatever you'd like.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								Like Minecraft, only better! More intuitive tool system - pickaxe & shovel are now incorporated into the same tool WAY better graphics Wider variety of creatures to tame or battle, including some with biome-specific subspecies Tamed creatures can be harvested without killing them Super-intuitive crafting interface - no need for a crafting table or checking the Wiki Wide variety of crafting plans to discover and build And more!...and the game is still under development!Very belated edit - if you bought the base game when it was first released, you do not need to buy pro.  Just open the game and the client should recognize you as pro.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played this game because it was free and held my interest, but now the addition of what is basically a necessity for most sandbox games in my opinion, is locked behind a paywall. This isn't like you, devs. You encourage players to be creative, it's in the name of the game, but since you got greedy, you're pretty much forcing free players to pay a hefty amount, and if they don't, they can't be creative and have fun like they used to be able to.The devs say that they're setting the Pro expansion up for "success" by removing features that we as F2P's love and enjoy. What they're really doing, is removing the Creativity from Creativerse.Game updates are supposed to introduce new things into the game, be it helpful bug fixes or new items that are supposed to keep the game fun, fresh, and interesting. Game updates are NOT supposed to turn users off of the game. Take Team Fortress 2 for an example; Valve recieved so much backlash on the 'Meet Your Match' update, so they listened to the community and fixed most of the problems with it.I do not reccomend this game in its current state, but if something were to change for the better in any coming updates, then I will have my keyboard ready to re-type this review all over again.MY FINAL SCORE FOR CREATIVERSE IS... 51%
