content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Good game.  4/5 Would recommend buying the finished product when released, but even for early access the game has a lot of content.  I put quite a bit of time into it, could have spent more building, but I'm not really a building guy, I prefer exploration, fighting etc.  If you enjoyed Minecraft, thisr is an improvement.  What I liked:-Graphics are nice, good lighting effects. I found myself stopping and looking around quite a bit.   -Lots of the biomes are really neat, the swamp especially I enjoyed when I first discovered it.  Canyons are also very cool.  -Recipie discoveries - I liked that it was tiered so that was really good.  I didn't like that I had to build some stuff to open the other stuff though, was kind of a waste of resources, but whatever. -Difficulty - Tier by tier the monsters where pretty tough, so whenever I went into combat I was really careful because ya never know what was going to happen.  As I got better weapons the stuff above ground was pretty much cake, but down underground there was never a time when I felt comfortable or secure.  What I didn't like:-You don't know what you don't know.  I'm still not sure how to get some of the items required to make some stuff.  I never saw an Egg the entire game.  I'm guessing you have to Tame something?  - Some of the items required to make stuff was tedious to gather, especially potions at times.  The resistance potions where kind of annoying to make.  Not a huge deal, but maybe get a bit more for less resources?  - Farming with the Hoe - This was way to slow.. I don't know if there was any other kind of item that made it faster, but tilling the grass/ground was 4 or 5 seconds per plot... it was time consuming. -Corruption mob density was a little high.  Because they had so many HP it was really tedious to fight because you got swarmed.  I was building terrain traps to farm stuff, I'm cool with that but it gets tedius when you want to explore but can't.  Suggestions:-Combat - I liked combat, it was challenging.  I felt maybe a medium power range weapon would be a good choice, something to soften mobs up before engaging?  I know there's bombs, but they are somewhat expensive to make. -Crafting Tabs - Let me tab off stuff if I like, as per ARK.-Gathering Water/Liquid was kind of annoying.  I felt that if I sat there, it should maybe speed way up as I collect the resource?  -Terraria, rare monster drops to summon bosses, etc.Anyhow, good game.  Free week was awesome, I'll buy the game for sure when it's out.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Good game.  4/5 Would recommend buying the finished product when released, but even for early access the game has a lot of content.  I put quite a bit of time into it, could have spent more building, but I'm not really a building guy, I prefer exploration, fighting etc.  If you enjoyed Minecraft, thisr is an improvement.  What I liked:-Graphics are nice, good lighting effects. I found myself stopping and looking around quite a bit.   -Lots of the biomes are really neat, the swamp especially I enjoyed when I first discovered it.  Canyons are also very cool.  -Recipie discoveries - I liked that it was tiered so that was really good.  I didn't like that I had to build some stuff to open the other stuff though, was kind of a waste of resources, but whatever. -Difficulty - Tier by tier the monsters where pretty tough, so whenever I went into combat I was really careful because ya never know what was going to happen.  As I got better weapons the stuff above ground was pretty much cake, but down underground there was never a time when I felt comfortable or secure.  What I didn't like:-You don't know what you don't know.  I'm still not sure how to get some of the items required to make some stuff.  I never saw an Egg the entire game.  I'm guessing you have to Tame something?  - Some of the items required to make stuff was tedious to gather, especially potions at times.  The resistance potions where kind of annoying to make.  Not a huge deal, but maybe get a bit more for less resources?  - Farming with the Hoe - This was way to slow.. I don't know if there was any other kind of item that made it faster, but tilling the grass/ground was 4 or 5 seconds per plot... it was time consuming. -Corruption mob density was a little high.  Because they had so many HP it was really tedious to fight because you got swarmed.  I was building terrain traps to farm stuff, I'm cool with that but it gets tedius when you want to explore but can't.  Suggestions:-Combat - I liked combat, it was challenging.  I felt maybe a medium power range weapon would be a good choice, something to soften mobs up before engaging?  I know there's bombs, but they are somewhat expensive to make. -Crafting Tabs - Let me tab off stuff if I like, as per ARK.-Gathering Water/Liquid was kind of annoying.  I felt that if I sat there, it should maybe speed way up as I collect the resource?  -Terraria, rare monster drops to summon bosses, etc.Anyhow, good game.  Free week was awesome, I'll buy the game for sure when it's out.

Early Access Review
								friends recommended this to me even when i'm already busy with some other builder games, ended up x6 times more hours played than all of them totalled.Review effect around 5/3/2016:+simple and fun+Environment develops slowly around you+cool different biomes with more new blocks to discover+underground-content filled+low spec requirement and small file size download+your best place to show your creativity in building+co-op-the more "crafted blocks" accumulates in the world, the laggier it gets for low-spec users-Early Access glitches you may expect-very simple combat mechanism-crafting lists are still increasing, currently not a lot. (3/4/2015)-no adventurous story gaming-strict & tight community vs toxic community exists (i think dota 2 is 'lightly' better.... no i'm not joking lol...)it has its own art, gr9 music, items and potentially immersive, would definitely recommend this as a co-op building exploration game to many friends. Its still in early access so don't expect much to spend your time long on.8/10 would definitely lose other friends for this game again.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Aside from being a Sandbox Voxel game like minecraft, it has it's own charms and seperates itself pretty well. I like the direction it is going and hope it continues to stay different than minecraft. What I notably like is:The crafting system - really interesting, makes me want to unlock all the recipesDifferent biomes - refreshing and interesting types of biomes even based off of seasons makes me want to explore around and see what I can find.Fear of caves - don't dig straight down...Creatures - not the generic cow and chicken combos i mean there are chickens but they are more cocktrice like and more interesting than just a normal mooing cow, plus the night creatures look scary :D at least you can see them most of the time ^^---------------------------------What I find so - so-The fighting is lacking, kinda makes me feel like it's turn based like when I am not even close enough or behind it I still get hit by attacks while i try to maneuver and evade it. -Food is rare, so is health regen-Could add some more filler content or more visible goals. I know it's there but, as someone who started out some of the things are a bit hard to find and some items aren't readily accessable which drags the crafting system back when you don't have the proper item or tools. But I do recommend it for people who enjoy Voxels and want something new and refreshing, maybe more for people who want to relax a bit. Not recommended for those who are hardcore or looking to 'conquer' land because it is actually a fairly relaxing game from what I can tell on the surface of the game itself and it's gameplay. I do look forward to see how it develops more!

content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								At first from looking at the screenshots, I thought this was another buggy, minecraft-esque voxel sandbox.I was wrong.I played it for a while, however it had one big flaw; it was almost featureless. I don't play Minecraft anymore, and honestly I never could really call it my favorite, however it still had a moderate amount of features. As a game developer and somewhat game player, through seeing things in past experience, this game is uncomparable in terms of features to many other games I've seen, as in it has VERY, VERY FEW. As in:Chops TreeGets CragwoodMakes big house in treeCan't figure out what to do in houseStarts miningMines for 2 hoursFind corruptionCan't figure out what to do in the corruptionGets diamondsAnd then there's pretty much nothing left!Another large issue that I see, is the CHILDLISHLY, COMPLETELY UNREALISTIC entities. While I in no way am in favor of the realism in Minecraft, at least it has COWS, and CHICKENS, and THINGS THAT DO NOT LOOK LIKE THEY CAME FROM A SHOW FOR LITTLE GIRLS, while in Creativerse, the same "wth is this" message is constantly flitting through my head.Plus, it barely has any form of entity that is HOSTILE!A leafy? What's a leafy?I'm sorry, but a game that has been in development for 1 1/2 years should not have simple issues with even being able to get to the main menu, have entities that look like they were drawn by 4-year-olds, or be in a situation where the only blocks are completely useless and random and the only thing you can do is make a pretty house.

Early Access Review
								I haven't even been playing this for an hour, and I'm already in love. The graphics are amazing, the music is lovely and the sound effects fit in pretty nicely with the world. The mechanics are way better than Minecraft's, and collecting materials isn't such a chore. I can see this replacing Minecraft once it's out of beta. This is just...so much better than Minecraft in every way. I look forward to following the development of this game.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Okay... Although i've only played for like 60+ hours, but i guess it's enough for me to finally make a review, since i've reached the deepest floor on  creativerse, and i kinda get the hang of the whole game. And this is my score for this game ( Please keep in mind that i have never played minecraft so i can't compare the 2 game) :Gameplay : 8.5Music : 8Crafting : 8.5Combat : 8 ( The combat is simple but the monsters and their unique spawn rate is unique )Unique : 8.5Longevity : 9! ( If you play this with friends!)IMPORTANT MESSAGE ON THE BOTTOM OF THE REVIEW! SO PLEASE DO READ THE REVIEW THOROUGHLY :)))A bit of my story about the game : For someone who has never played minecraft and stuff... For me this game is amazing,This game has endless possibilities, I can do almost anything that i want in this game... The graphics is awesome, the gameplay is good on its on way, There are tons of unique monsters.The first time i played this game... I was confused, because i have never played minecraft before, and there is barely any Tutorial for this game, but after playing a few hours, I'm starting to get the hang of the game and i really enjoyed it.I was playing with my buddy and at first we were building a small treehouse and stuff, and we thought that it was amazing... But then after a few days, we explored that this game has ( What we called it ):1. Spring Zone2. Summer Zone3. Autumn Zone4. Winter ZoneAnd after we look around, we decided to move our house to the Winterrrr Zoneeeeee....!!!And then we build our own castle, WE DESTROYED THE WHOLE MOUNTAINNNN WITH A ♥♥♥♥IN BOMB LOLOL.... It was amazing xD... And we made our own monster breeding place, using the soil and the ecosystem based on where they spawn. so we basically dont have to walk to actually farm for the monsters.OKAY BACK TO THE REVIEW! ~~~~~GAMEPLAY :The gameplay for me is unique, simple , and fun ... It doesn't require you that much of skill to actually enjoy the whole game... And as someone who has never played a single sandbox, voxel based open world game.... this game is amazing, because i can actually do almost anything that i want. And the features in this game varies, and it never bores me.- You can suck the ground and mine the ore based on what layer of soil you are in... There are :------- 1. Normal Soil------- 2. Layers with Obsidian and a few useful ores------- 3. Layers with iron and a few useful ores------- 4. Layers with Mythril and a few useful ores------- 5. Layers with Diamond and a few useful ores------- 6. LAVA LAYERZZZZ------- 7. End of the world (?) Where you can gather Lumite...ANDDD... each layers has its own unique monsters with unique drop for crafting! Best way to open the space for mining is using BOMBS!!! easy space lol.Watch this guide : 


YouTube™ Video: Creativerse Gameplay - MAGIC BOMBS! ( Let's Play E11 ) 

			Views: 37,794		

			MOAR Creativerse Peeps! Creativerse is a sandbox adventure game set in a beautiful yet treacherous world shrouded in mystery.		

 MUSICCC : The music is quite soothing and it's really enjoyable while playing the game ...Crafting : The crafting is quite basic, as usual... you gather stuffs and when you have enough ingredient , fuala~ you can craft those items...BUT... If you want to open the next recipe , you basically have to AT LEAST craft the recipe before it... OnceSo basically if you want to open the whole recipe, just craft em all... although not all recipe has the next recipe if you craft 'emAND WHAT MAKES IT UNIQUE :There are different processing machine for each kinds of crafting, and it's what makes the game quite unique, and you can multitask different craft in a different machine! and you can also make unlimited amount of that machine too! amazing right...?!COMBATTT :The combat itself is quite simple, just mash-click your button lol... But what makes it unique is the kinds of monsters and items that they droppedAAAANNDD Where they spawn! you can actually make an ecosystem just like where they used to live, and the monster itself will spawn! That way, you dont have to actually run from side to side just to gather those monsters item, since this game has limited amount of teleport machine, which is limited to one teleport machine for each players.UNIQUEEE : This is game TO me is unique, because you can do almost anything, and it really differs from other sandbox game that i've witnessed from youtube and stuff... The gameplay and etc is much more polished than the ancestor... Minecraft, although there are some parts that still lacks of something...But overall this game is fun, enjoyable, unique, and if you play this with your friends, this game is just amazingly fun in its own way lol trust me!LONGEVITY :The game is very fun, it doesnt get boring fast, and even after 200+hours i would even still play this game and smile like a dork everytime i finished building something with my buddies.One key to make this game longlasting ... Play this game with your friends... seriously... it gets really fun especially if you play this game with teamspeak or any voicechat program...SOOO This is the end of my review! I hope you enjoy reading my first...detailed review i have ever made. I hope it makes it easier for you to decide to play this game or not... AND IF YOU WANT TO JOIN MY WORLD ON CREATIVERSE... SIMPLY JUST ADD ME, AND CHAT ME WHEN IM ONLINE :)MY WORLD IS STILL RATHER SMALL BUT I BASICALLY HAVE COVERED MOST OF THE IMPORTANT ASPECTS OF THE GAME SUCH AS ORE MINING, MONSTER BREEDING, AND A MOUNTAIN SIZED CASTLE :)

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								Well, I really liked the game at first but here are some reasons why the "magic" gone after some minutes of gaming.At first it seems like a more polished version of minecraft but it lacks some basic things that makes it impossible to surpass the title of "bad clone".:::Enemies:::They are too few and with barely no variety, the game seems like a lego game that has some strong agressive enemies (caves and canyons) with bad AI and their melee attacks hit you from far distances.The only way I found to not being hit by monsters is non-stop walking away backwards and hitting them like 3 blocks away while you hit the air and damages them ._.They all look really cute (which makes me wonder if this game is supposed to kids 12 and below).:::Biomes:::All the biomes looks the same, but with recolor, I couldn't find any weather effects.The game has only night and day, in the snow biome you get a freeze meter that didn't seem to have any effect on actual gameplay.:::Blocks:::The solid blocks all have the same atributes. Example: Sand blocks doesn't fall when the block below it is removed.If you remove the logs on the bottom of the trunk the tree doesn't fall or "drop", you have to remove every single block, one by one.I really loved the game in the first minutes, it felt very polished and well optimized, and the asthetics....some people might not like it, but i like the toy-ish texture overall however sometimes you feel like you are playing a game for kids, mostly because of the lack of clutter on the biomes and the enemies being toy-ish too.I know it is a free game, but I guess they could make it better and there are some reviews that point out really good points to improve, unfortunately my english is very bad since I don't use it in a daily basis, so I will end my review here.The game feels kinda empty, but it is worth a try (it's free!), your younger bros/cousins/kids would enjoy it a lot as a minecraft alternative (I guess.)This review is subject to change if the game sees some improvement.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								At first from looking at the screenshots, I thought this was another buggy, minecraft-esque voxel sandbox.I was wrong.I played it for a while, however it had one big flaw; it was almost featureless. I don't play Minecraft anymore, and honestly I never could really call it my favorite, however it still had a moderate amount of features. As a game developer and somewhat game player, through seeing things in past experience, this game is uncomparable in terms of features to many other games I've seen, as in it has VERY, VERY FEW. As in:Chops TreeGets CragwoodMakes big house in treeCan't figure out what to do in houseStarts miningMines for 2 hoursFind corruptionCan't figure out what to do in the corruptionGets diamondsAnd then there's pretty much nothing left!Another large issue that I see, is the CHILDLISHLY, COMPLETELY UNREALISTIC entities. While I in no way am in favor of the realism in Minecraft, at least it has COWS, and CHICKENS, and THINGS THAT DO NOT LOOK LIKE THEY CAME FROM A SHOW FOR LITTLE GIRLS, while in Creativerse, the same "wth is this" message is constantly flitting through my head.Plus, it barely has any form of entity that is HOSTILE!A leafy? What's a leafy?I'm sorry, but a game that has been in development for 1 1/2 years should not have simple issues with even being able to get to the main menu, have entities that look like they were drawn by 4-year-olds, or be in a situation where the only blocks are completely useless and random and the only thing you can do is make a pretty house.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Aside from being a Sandbox Voxel game like minecraft, it has it's own charms and seperates itself pretty well. I like the direction it is going and hope it continues to stay different than minecraft. What I notably like is:The crafting system - really interesting, makes me want to unlock all the recipesDifferent biomes - refreshing and interesting types of biomes even based off of seasons makes me want to explore around and see what I can find.Fear of caves - don't dig straight down...Creatures - not the generic cow and chicken combos i mean there are chickens but they are more cocktrice like and more interesting than just a normal mooing cow, plus the night creatures look scary :D at least you can see them most of the time ^^---------------------------------What I find so - so-The fighting is lacking, kinda makes me feel like it's turn based like when I am not even close enough or behind it I still get hit by attacks while i try to maneuver and evade it. -Food is rare, so is health regen-Could add some more filler content or more visible goals. I know it's there but, as someone who started out some of the things are a bit hard to find and some items aren't readily accessable which drags the crafting system back when you don't have the proper item or tools. But I do recommend it for people who enjoy Voxels and want something new and refreshing, maybe more for people who want to relax a bit. Not recommended for those who are hardcore or looking to 'conquer' land because it is actually a fairly relaxing game from what I can tell on the surface of the game itself and it's gameplay. I do look forward to see how it develops more!

content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								My feelings on this game are mixed and for that reason I will neither recommend it nor will I not recommend it. I'll leave that decision for those who decide to try the game.The following is my Creativerse experience:  At first I was intrigued by it and wanted to see how it compared to other games similar to this that have come out since the creation of Minecraft. After playing for a bit I started to get a little more interested and thought it might be something I could have fun playing. I loved the idea of the blueprints system and was hoping to work towards building the fort some day. However I dont think I will be playing anymore after my short frustrating experience with the game. After gathering and crafting many materials I ended up losing everything after dying to a glowing crab that somehow managed to get into my "safe room". I had finally found some obsidian and the extractors take 5 minutes to gather the ore. This of course being 5 real life minutes and the in-game clock ticks by much faster. Being a new player I hadn't had much chance to make the nicer gear which is what I was working towards. When I noticed it was getting close to night time I decided to build a little wall around myself so I could mine my ore in peace. Just as the exctractors where almost finished thats when that pesky crab came in and killed me. I don't know if it glitched through the wall I made or dug its way in but if it glitched its way in that bs needs to be fixed. As a side note although at the beginning of my review I said I would neither recommend or not recommend the game becuase steam forces me to pick one inorder to post this review I am picking not recommend.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game, Creativerse is fun. Sure from the looks of it, a person might say that "oh its just a minecraft clone" which is true to an extent. The graphics are voxel and boxy, but they are WAY better than the♥♥♥♥♥♥ minecraft displays on your screen. GRAPHICS= 8/10It very pretty, the textures look great and the sky at night is a sight that you should experience. I'm sure as this game further develops it will look even more stunning. However, the reason why I gave it a 8/10 is because some of the textures need work like the monster textures and blocks often come off as looking the same as the one next to it.GAMEPLAY 8/10To put in a few words. Creativerse is jam-packed with many things to do, caves to explore resources to mine. Yes at it's core gameplay mechanics, it might be borrowing from Minecraft in terms of mining in caves and gathering resources to smelt and repeat. But where Creativerse is different is its execution of the way you mine for blocks. Instead of a pickaxe you suck blocks up into your glove, and the more you upgrade the less time it takes to mine. The movement in Creativerse is fluid like silk cheese, jumping really feels like you are actually jumping. Combat is more or less the same as any other game, point and click to hit. You can tame the monsters that you can encounter and feed/shower them for various resources. Also monsters change in the night time so when they do you better build shelter. CONCLUSION= 8/10REALLY AS OF NOW I can say this EARLY ACCESS game is solid so far, its graphics and shaders make the world of creativerse feel less blocky than it actually is + slopes which is good. But besides that what creativerse needs now is a sense of direction to guide players into what this game can offer. I had to wiki most of the game's many blocks and mechanics such as taming monsters to feed and shower them. Hopefully in the future there is an option for character design like gender perhaps? What i do like about the game is that it attempts to have the player uncover a story through ripped pages found randomly on the map, but lets be honest who would read that I wouldn't.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a fun game.  I'm not sure what the crying is about Pro level. I played it as a free user for a while and liked it enough to buy the Pro version, and while the flashlight in particular is pretty handy, nothing you get with Pro is OP or P2W.  Really it's worth it to me just for the ability to set some fun modifiers, and have multiple worlds going.That being said, the worlds are pretty huge and even a single world will keep you exploring for many hours.  This is basically minecraft but with better visuals, and I like the mechanics better.  More variety of enemies and block types, too.  I like the recipe system (certain blocks require you to find/loot recipes), and the blueprints are fun.The free version is great for a F2P game, the paid Pro level is worth it IMHO.Keep in mind though, this is an Early Access game.  There are still some bugs in there, some of them requiring restart, and once it completely locked my machine up to the point of having to restart with the physical power switch. Hopefully these will be worked out over time.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a new review on the game, now that I've really played it. The base concepts are very similar to Minecraft: Build, mine, explore, KILL. The way that Creativerse executes it, on the other hand, is different from its predecessor.Tl;wr: Creativerse adds onto the already-great concept of Minecraft. It has more of everything, and the fact that it's free makes it better in basically every way. Overall, would definitely recommend for literally months of entertainment. Now, for the actual details.MiningThe first thing I want to note is the mining system. it still has tiers like Minecraft, with maybe two more tiers than it, but the way that you dig is different. You still attempt to find caves, since that provides easy ores, but in Creativerse you can do mass excavating quickly and the way the mining tools work is different. You only get slightly faster mining when you get a better tool, but you need better tools to get through the different tiers of the world. On the note of ores, Minecraft just treats them like another thing to be mined. Creativerse on the other hand requires a disposable item to be placed on the ore to give you up to 16 of that ore (if you use the best item on the weakest ore).CombatIt's not much different, but there are some added complexities. Minecraft has only enemies that melee, do ranged, or just explode. It's lackluster, but it works. With Creativerse, there are specialized enemies like Warmworms, some enemies that are peaceful until attacked, and some enemies that do knockback or special effects. there are also special bombs and potions that can be consumed while battling, unlike Minecraft. It's only a little better, frankly. (also, more variety in Creativerse. ALOT.)BuildingThe building is actually a whole helluvalot better than Minecraft. With Creativerse, there are Blueprints for the non-creative, free rotation for the clever, and special lights and decor for the creative. There are also more furniture options, such as tables, processing stations, and mechanisms. Wiring is also better, since it's based on linking instead of using a material.ExplorationThe exploration is actually pretty fun, since it has more varied biomes and the map is easier to use and give people directions on. The layers of the world are also great, since you can go (from highest to lowest) to the surface, cave, fossil, stalactite, igneous, and corruption layer. The ores get better as you go down, and you don't find bad ores in the deepest places (like how minecraft does).MultiplayerThe multiplayer is also done better than Minecraft. The game is technically ONLY multiplayer, but you loners out there can put a password on your epic singleplayer world. For worlds that allow it, you can claim plots of land to be yours and maybe someone else's very easily. Just gather some resources, open the map, select some land, and enjoy! Creativerse also has a huge list of all of the "Public" worlds that you can join no matter what. Friends can join easier, you can join randoms easier, and overall it's a good experience.InterfaceThe interface is well made, with the recipe system different from anything I know. Recipes are gained in a sort of "Unlock Tree", kind of like skills in a skill tree. You always have a map of the whole world, and you can fill out the map by visiting diferent "sectors". There's a blueprints tab for the blueprints mentioned in Building, which allows you to convert small amounts of materials into reusable and relatively easy to follow plans. Overall, would definitely recommend. It's a minecraft clone, sure, but one that's on content steroids.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								So my opinion on this game is buy it! It's $20, and lots of fun. If you like Minecraft, you will love creativerse. This game is a huge upgrade to Minecraft. The graphics are 10 times better (I don't play minecraft without a resource pack), what you can create with the blocks available is amazing, and right now I would say there is no need for a modded version. The recent update did a lot for this game imo. Before the update I hadn't put a ton of time into the game. Since the update I have been floored on all the changes they have made. Now I say all this with love and admiration but it is not without flaws. I have had some issues where teleporting from one place to another wont load into the new place I teleported to and had to leave world and restart. I have also left world in one of these situations and and went to reload and got nothing but a black screen. On occasion there is some lag but it is nothing major. As for a lot of these recent bad reviews... Quit your crybaby crap! Whaaaaa they want money for something they created and I used to love but now ♥♥♥♥ them because they want $20. The fact that you can't be bothered to pay $20 to purchase a great game when your computer most likely cost you anywhere from $300 to $3000 is complete rubbish. These Devs basically worked for free up to that point creating something for you to enjoy. Now they would like to see some return on their investment... SHOCKER! Do you like getting a pay check at work? I mean by your standards you should just work for free and let others enjoy having you around! Think about it this way, what other games do you own? I'd be willing to bet the majority of you own quite a few games. Some in the price range of $50 to $60 and you never got to try that game before you purchased it. This game let you play for free for quite a while and all they are asking for in return for the Pro version with all the bells and whistles is $20. You can still play for free though, with no money out of pocket. $20 is not a lot for a good game. For a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game sure I could understand not wanting to pay for a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game but this is a really good game!

content:
Posted: February 14
Early Access Review
								"oh, come on, not another *mincrafty* game.   Whatever, I guess I'll try it."  Creativerse isn't TERRIBLE.  But it isn't amazing either.  As usual, you'd want to find shelter, in any survival game, and find some coal.  Doesn't sound too difficult..... Having no clue what coal looked like in this game, I just started TEARING apart the ground inside of the hole I dug.  Took me 4 hours to find one coal "node", as is what they're called here, abd when I did I said " Finally, that took waaaaaaayyyyy to long, *click click click*, why can't I mine this?!? *Tip thingy pops up in the top right of the screen*  "You'll need an extractor to get some coal."  What the f- fine, fine, fine then.  I'll make one of these, "extractors", and I'll finally get my coal.  But on the bright side, the recipe for an extractor is EXTREMELY cheap, as it is the weakest.  Made one and ran back to the coal, and left clicked, wrong button, right click.  "There we go!  Why did that take so long?!?!!  Back in Minecraft," Yes I will be making a lot of comparisons to Minecraft in this review. "This would've taken me just 5 minutes after getting situated."  Come to find out that takes more time to get the coal, not that much time, but I was pretty irritated about this whole thing, since I was at this for 4 and a half hours at this point.  So, just a minute and half later I got 5 coal from one node.  "Not bad, I guess. still, I wish that wasn't so hard."  Yes, after playing this, and liking it thus far, I realize that it shouldn't have been that difficult.  Now I know that.  But after using the extractor, I noticed that I didn't get it back.  Which upsetted me just as an inconvienence, since I knew then that I would be carrying atleast 10 at a time, plopping them here and there.  Then it hit me, I can just place one down and do something else, then come back to it, and grab the coal.  That is a HUGE plus.  This game is ALL about progress.  The start of the game is a little to slow for my liking.  However, it is largely Pay to Play, as you can only have ONE WORLD at a time.  You HAVE to buy the "Premium Upgrade" to do anything.  Like the world settings.  You want peacful enemies?  Buy premium!  You want extra inventory space?  Buy premium!  Want more than one world?  Buy premium!  This is the kind of marketing that I WISH NEVER CAME TO LIGHT!  I like having the ability to make more worlds as I please.  I don't want to buy a piece of memory space for that sh*t.  I have an intense Love Hate relationship with this game.  So far, in the eight hours that I have put into this game, it has crashed once, but probably it was because I was messing a little with the settings, trying to fix a few things here and there.  I recommend this if you are getting tired of Minecraft, as this is a more, "special" type of "minecraft-esque" game.  One last thing though.  Fix the craftable light sources, in the mean time, I'll just say, make a LOT of torches and find coal as soon as possible, you can't make the better torches without it.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								A lovely game to fill in that Minecraft-shaped void in your heart! Creativerse has no greater objective and no major bosses to find. You simply exist to create and mine things as you please! It is in general very soothing to play (unless you're digging in the deepest layer, which is kinda dark) and, best of all, free! (Game is funded by optional microtransactions for special blocks and blueprints to make structures.) PROS: - Tons of blocks to decorate and build.- Different layers and biomes to explore.- Great graphics! sunshafts and high res textures. - Teleporting, so you don't have to walk back to places if you've built the teleporter. - Hotkeys can be changed! - Graphics can be lowered! - You can tame animals; farm them or just have them follow you around. - Great soundtrack! - Easy multiplayer! You can even keep it private by adding a password. - Friendly for people of all ages to play; very forgiving upon death. - the ability to claim chunks of land, lock chests/furnaces/extractors, and so on.- Rotate blocks with the 'R' key! -------EHH- Sometimes light sources glitch out and do not provide light; digging up blocks nearby fixes it, but it can get rather annoying, especially in the dark. - Pets set to follow do so very closely; they do NOT help in combat. - requires Wifi to play.- Lots of block variety can cause inventory to become very messy.-------Overall, very nice! Worth a shot to anyone looking for a block-y game or just wanting to kill time.

								Creativerse is an Excellent Game!  Nevermind that it still says "Early Access."This game is fully functional and I have found no bugs after 35+ hours.This is a bigger and much better Terraria.  Terraria was great and I can't wait for Terraria 2, but they will have to work hard for T2 to be as good as Creativerse.I've played many open world sandbox games and I'm often disappointed, but not with this game.This is easily my favorite open world sandbox game, and there's more to come.Also, I sent a message to the developers about a question/issue.  (I had "lost" some items and didn't understand why.)  They wrote back the very next day and explained why the items "disappeared."  Then, they replaced the missing items via an in-game drop in my inventory!Talk about GREAT customer service!  Not only are the Devs working continuously on this game, but they respond to questions ASAP!I highly recommend this game!  Have fun!

content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Going to start this off like so many others. I dont usually write reviews but this time I decided to for a few reasons but mainly for the fact that they took a F2P game and made it into a Free demo with an option to buy the real game. Some people talk about the "Pro" feature as no big deal and how it doesnt impact the underlying game play. Well.. True.. Going pro doesnt magically make it so that you dont have to harvest blocks, build houses, etc. They then talk about a few of the perks included in there and give them as examples of how just because it is pay now doesnt make it better. Well the issue I take with this is these "bonus" items could have easily been placed in their store for you to purchase a la carte. These reviews are missing the point of the other negative reviews. The point is just what has been stated. A F2P game has been turned into a demo version with limited features.Is this game fun?YesDid this game have some interesting ideas on world building?YesDo I think the devs deserve to get paid?YesDo I think they should have gone about getting paid in a different manner?Also YesBut would I recommend this game?Not any moreLike other reviewers said, games like this are a dine a dozen. Even "big ticket" MMO games are moving away from subscription based services and focusing on the micro-transactions (in app purchases) because they know that is where the true money is.While I dont think I will uninstall the game since it really doesnt take up that much space I dont believe I will be playing it any more unless something changes where it becomes F2P again with micro-transactions as the way to make their money.

content:
Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								First off, I will say that this is a fantastic game. I've been playing since before it went free-to-play, and I can say the gameplay is solid, the terrain generation is stunning, and there lots of fun toys and decorative blocks to play around with. They've continued to consistently add content to this game making it better and better. However, I cannot currently recommend this game. There are several issues that severely impact the quality of the game. -First and foremost are the lighting bugs that have gone unaddressed for over a year. When too many lighting objects are in an area, they start behaving strangely. Some kind of algorithm causes them to cease producing light even though they are lit. This makes creating large interiors or nightscapes massively difficult and also makes creature spawns incredibly problematic.-Liquids do not behave properly. Erasing a source block is nearly impossible the way that liquid generates, movement within water is unnecessarily difficult, and liquids often flow in nonsensical patterns.-There are various issues with targeting occlusion, with various interactive objects being prioritized in an inappropriate matter, such as signs being selected when you're looking at a chest, or not being able to remove doors or fans or pressure plates. Additionally, the targeting glitches can cause you to inadvertently place static blocks over interactive objects, effectively deleting the interactive object. When the static block is removed, an "Empty Block" remains in place, irrevocably occupying that space.-The scarcity of certain materials is absolutely nonsensical. Once you have the proper equipment, finding diamonds and lumite (the highest tier materials) is absolutely trivial, while finding even meager amounts of iron requires hours of mining.A lot of these issues would be forgivable if not for the fact that they've existed for quite some time, and while the consistent delivery of new content is appreciated, the continuance of these issues is exasperating.

content:
Posted: September 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse is an Excellent Game!  Nevermind that it still says "Early Access."This game is fully functional and I have found no bugs after 35+ hours.This is a bigger and much better Terraria.  Terraria was great and I can't wait for Terraria 2, but they will have to work hard for T2 to be as good as Creativerse.I've played many open world sandbox games and I'm often disappointed, but not with this game.This is easily my favorite open world sandbox game, and there's more to come.Also, I sent a message to the developers about a question/issue.  (I had "lost" some items and didn't understand why.)  They wrote back the very next day and explained why the items "disappeared."  Then, they replaced the missing items via an in-game drop in my inventory!Talk about GREAT customer service!  Not only are the Devs working continuously on this game, but they respond to questions ASAP!I highly recommend this game!  Have fun!

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								I logged in and what immediately grabbed my attention was the very detailed hand of my character with his glowing wrist contraption, which allow you as the player character to manipulate the world ala minecraft, left click for pulling blocks, removing them and placing them in your inventory, right click for placing. The game highlights block you are focusing on so it you won't make mistakes. The games main menu and interface are very sleek, and from the looks of it all you need is the name of a world to hop in and play with your friends, all hosted with Creativerse, no extra time and money and frustration out of your pocket trying to make your own server or be forced to live with the rules of another. Top notch. There is an ingame story that sells builds, that you furnish with your own blocks, sort of a graphical blueprint if you will, and very detailed block recipes. The game is cheap, and just like Trove I don't find the items for sale to be game breaking. Similarly wondrous looking blocks are available to build ingame, use the shop as you see fit.You spawn with a platform that sets your spawn, and allows you to teleport to it by simply pressing T. It appears you can teleport to  other players "Touchstones", there were slots in the menu that comes up but I have yet to test this feature. Upon death all of your inventory items are placed in an urn, and giant white beam of light shoots high in the sky from its location and on the minimap a skull is placed so that you can find your body easily, if not get back to it easily. This feature alone will save me from rage-quitting like I did with Minecraft for weeks at a time after dying to laval in Hardcore with diamonds or some nonsense.The graphics are very well done, think HD block pack, very smooth, water needs some work, but it overall fits the theme and looks very fluid unlike default Minecraft liquids. The crafting is varied and unique, needing multiple stations to craft at like Minecraft. Instead of mining all ore by hand with a pick you use your hand device and upgrade it with chips, without the need to carry an axe, pick and shovel. For the progression ores you use extractors which essentially is a device you place on the ore, it then breaks the block down into ore, the amount dependent on the level of extractor used. Currently as I am working with obsidian, its 5 minutes per block. This is a nice change of pace from just clicking and clicking, it gives you a chance to step back and explore a bit while the ore is being extracted.TL:DR - If you like Minecraft, STOP AND BUY THIS NOW!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Dig Dig Dig. It almost seems as if this entire game is based off digging. Sure, after hours of digging through dirt, rock, and siltstone you'll find some mysterious caverns and some monsters to kill. Play this on a late night while wearing headphones and it'll scare ye' more than a few times. Dig a lil' further and you'll find diamond and lava. Hooray. As some point you'll realize that there is just not enough content, let alone a goal to reach for. Of course, building a house, office building, tower, or whatever comes to mind, is pretty amusing...until you realize that no one but you will actually see it. With everyone creating their own world there is no chance of interaction between other players. Oh how I wish there was just one gigantic world....As for item creation, the list is somewhat bleak. It starts off with an alchemy-type process in which you need to find resources to unlocks a few items to create. Exciting. Later (but not much later) it ends with creating swords to create other swords and doors to unlock other doors....same with grenades... In otherwords, the list is unorthodox and has no definite clear order while ignoring the gigantic gaps between items. The game could accomplish much more with many more useful resources, which then could easily extend the item construction list. What it needs for me to come back: More extractable resources, one world for all, extended item list, bigger monsters to slay.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								A lot of you will compare this game to Minecraft, so let me tell you a few things:1. It's not Minecraft.2. It's FREE.3. It's still in early alpha, so it will get even better.If those three reasons aren't enough for you to try this game, then you can stop reading and ignore this review.The graphics (texture detail) are really good. When I've tried Minecraft a couple of times before I always got a headache after a few hours, because of all the pixelated stuff going on there. It was hard to see and it was hard on the eyes. Even with mods that used 2x more detailed textures. This game is still a block/voxel based sandbox, but it's the first one that actually looks good. There are a lot of materials and resources, way more than your usual sandbox game. The crafting system is really cool and unique.The game is awesome. If you like sandbox games you should definitely buy this one... Oh wait, it's FREE!

content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I first saw this game, I expected a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Minecraft clone with endless microtransactions.  But it was free, and I saw no reason not to try it.After fourty hours in the span of about half a month, here I am. It does have microtransactions, but nothing you need  to survive (I spent the gold they gave me on a treehouse, lmao). And it's far from a minecraft clone.It operates on the same premise- Mine blocks and gather resources to expand your territory and better fight the creatures that come in the night. After that, though, it's got it's own really interesting spin- one that takes it to a new level. Gameplay:Like I said, the premise is like Minecraft's. Mine blocks, defend yourself from hostile creatures, and expand your world. However, it's got its own system. You have a mining cell, fit onto your wrist to gather and hold pieces of the world around you. And you can craft anything, anywhere, with no crafting bench. So long as you have one somewhere and you've gotten the refined materials for it. To make food, you get a cooking station as well. And you forge ores at a, well at a forge.Your ores are much the same way. you upgrade said mining cells to dig deeper into the earth and gather more precious materials from nodes. However, to do this, you need extractors (and time). You attach it to a node, then it will break it down for you. At this point, it's gone, and you're left with everything you need to keep grinding your way down.But the deeper you go, the more dangerous things get. The enemies get tougher and more vicious, and there are more dangers, lava, and after a while, even just being that deep starts to take a toll. You'll have a meter filling up, and when it's full, you'll take damage. Cute and fuzzy the creatures of the world may look, they can be bloodthirsty as all hell.But that's what makes it really fun, the challenge. 10/10 would get mauled by adorable lizards again.Story:There's not much of one, really. Someone left you out in the middle of nowhere to survive (or not) on your own. And through various journal scraps, you find out more about someone (or maybe multiple someones) who've been there before you through journal pages. Now, I love a good story. But I also love the freedom to make one up myself through bits and pieces. So for me, this one gets 7/10, would read way too much into random journal scraps again.Overall:The game's simple to get into, the learning curve is tough, but not brutal, and it's addictive. Between expanding your base(s) and exploring what the world has to offer, you could lose a whole night playing this without even realizing. Having to wait a long time for some of the materials is a slight pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥ but it's nothing that would ruin the game.Easily a 9/10. I'd recommend this to anyone, at least to try out. After all, it's free, so there's nothing to lose (but time), and a really great new game to gain!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is an easy to learn building/exploration type game. And any similarities to other titels such as minecraft, rust, terr-.. THEY are all mearly happenstances:) The games greatest virtue is the strait forward and easy multiplayer setup. You just click multiplayer, write name and password, and then all your friends can join easily. You become the admin, but the searver is hosted by the game creaters, so any pc can host. Especially joining through steam is perfected. Additionaly the game has recipies for everything, and these recepies are displayed clearly and smoothly. While also not cluttering the screen. Recipies are learned many different ways, by killing, looting, exploring or in case of the most esecial recipies; by creating the item one matirial tier further down, or in case of multiplayer, by having it in your inventory.(inc. someone else made it) The game is artisticly beutiful, especially the mobs are highly uniqe, original and interesting. The only lacking part of this game is an option menue inside the main menue. Having to host a personal world if order to create a EU character before joining a friends EU server. And finally: The lack of content. 4 friends all working together and rushing finishing the game, not bothering to gather extra rescourses or building more than a big shack. Can finish the game in 8 hours. 8 well spent hours.My advice, pick it for a LAN, host a server, get everyone on, and then GET the best extracter in the game.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								I played during the free week and decided not to buy the game simply because it will eventually be F2P with an in-game store.  Right now, it costs money to play as a way to help fund the developers during Early Access.  It's already in a playable state with a lot of content, but it will get a lot better from the looks of things.  I recommend this game as a future endeavor and hope you will check it out when it's done.Creativerse is a Minecraft-inspired building block game with very similar gameplay mechanics but also vastly superior graphics and input support.  It is already a very stable game build with a lot of content to keep you busy.  The in-game store also looks promising with some unique recipes, redeemable codes, daily free coins, and building blueprints.  I also enjoyed the game's crafting system and unique monster designs.  It also helps that the world is not entirely voxel-based and has beautiful art.  I look forward to future content but will wait for the game to go free-to-play so I can play the full experience.

content:
Posted: April 18
Early Access Review
								Looks like a cute modern minecraft with better animations and much more interactive UI.It's actually a horror game. I can't stop shatting my pants. Some enemy is dangerous at day. Most is dangerous at night, but it's okay you are pro. But the mines! The mines are filled with deathtrapes and lurking AI waiting in the dark to rush you down! I remember the first time. I thought they can't climb through the 1x1 hole! Than I saw a blue light and fallen down. Soon I was surrended by eyes and horroristic morbid faces! I was running trying to fight, but they are much much stronger, faster and better.After that, each moment is a passing nightmare. Every ambient sound, every bit of growl! Is that my steps? OR IS IT THEIRS.I live on the top of the trees, with security, with traps and bombs attached to everything. But it's just not enough. You are NEVER SAFE.Good game though.

								As soon as I saw the amazing graphics for a blocky game, I said to myself, "Ok they are a serious group people I guess". Then, many things started to hook me like the deep and inspiring sountrack, great concept of creating worlds and making public (of course there is an option for a password), and the amount of things you can accomplish along with the surplus of variety of items in the world. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								A lot of you will compare this game to Minecraft, so let me tell you a few things:1. It's not Minecraft.2. It's FREE.3. It's still in early alpha, so it will get even better.If those three reasons aren't enough for you to try this game, then you can stop reading and ignore this review.The graphics (texture detail) are really good. When I've tried Minecraft a couple of times before I always got a headache after a few hours, because of all the pixelated stuff going on there. It was hard to see and it was hard on the eyes. Even with mods that used 2x more detailed textures. This game is still a block/voxel based sandbox, but it's the first one that actually looks good. There are a lot of materials and resources, way more than your usual sandbox game. The crafting system is really cool and unique.The game is awesome. If you like sandbox games you should definitely buy this one... Oh wait, it's FREE!

content:
Posted: February 26
Early Access Review
								Likes:-Run's great at it's current state, even on a terrible computer like mine.-The crafting system requires you to make more components out of the materials you gather and takes time to make them to give a more realistic feel.Dislikes:-It's a MineCraft clone and doesn't even try to hide it. Clones don't usually have a lasting future.-It is pay to win and pay to play despite what the developer said in the Early Access information as you can pay for an advantage over other players and have to pay to unlock certain features.-You cannot play offline, you must have an internet connection to play this game.-According to the community the worlds are templates, not randomly generated.-The recipe system is nonsensical.-It becomes incredibly easy and waters down the experience after you make a huge coal/diamond farm (This is a feature the developer fully supports) and realize that you can obtain an infinite amount of water/tar,etc. (Unknown if the developer supports this but it's apparently existed for a very long time.)-To beat/tame any monster in the game, simply move around them.-You can tame creatures but they serve such little purpose which is gathering materials you could've just killed them for. You'd think that they would fight along side you at first.-You do not even need the strongest Mining Cell which is Lumite, the only purpose it serves is to gather corrupted water or Lava.-The tree's are massive and you have to manually destroy the leaves yourself or waste a fire potion, liquid lava, or start a bonfire to set it on fire. (Seriously, it's ridiculous how hard it is to start a fire in this game.)-Some items/blocks are completely worthless.The plot seems to be that you're just a child dumped onto a random planet for whatever reason with no interest in questioning why, getting revenge or even leaving the planet but you seem to be happy about the whole ordeal 100% of the time. You also seem to have access to some futuristic looking equipment but you gotta ask yourself why in the world you're running around with swords instead of space pistols and chunks of metallic armor instead of some kind of barrier.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse is an interesting and well-made Minecraft-Clone.Similar enough, it takes place in a world full of cube-shaped objects. Including the trees, mountains and so on. You can explore the big land freely, change it to your liking and create everything you can imagine, turning the scenery into something completely different.It's a world without much gravity. Blocks and other stuff will stay in mid air when you remove everything around or below them. You will find a variety of creatures living in many different biomes. Some are friendly, others are hostile and will attack on sight. They are strangely persistant and will explore the area until they find their way towards you and can attack you.From the materials they drop upon defeat and the ones you gather on your journeys you can craft different qualities of armor and swords. No bows or such, but you can find some items to throw from safe distance. Snow balls, pinecones, bombs...Once you are done buildung your base and exploring the surface, you can go below. Very far below. The underworld has its own biomes, but they are below each other. Stalactite layer, lava layer, corruption layer. That's as far as I got. The overall difficulty is usually fair, but down there it can get very hard to survive and you will find yourself quite challenged. It's also a beautiful sight to explore all the new areas.Oh, you can also do all that with others. I guess it would be funny. I played it solo on a world I created for myself to freely explore everything and it kept me well entertained for over 40 hours. So if you feel like Minecraft could be interesting to you, but you don't want to spend money on it, give this free gem here a chance.One last thing: On the current state the game still has a few bugs. Don't expect anything perfect. Monsters will attack you from behind obstacles like doors and walls if you get to near. Jumping will rarely lift you off into the highs instead of just letting you jump. Prepare for a painful landing when that happens. It will also happen to enemies from time to time.

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								A lovely game to fill in that Minecraft-shaped void in your heart! Creativerse has no greater objective and no major bosses to find. You simply exist to create and mine things as you please! It is in general very soothing to play (unless you're digging in the deepest layer, which is kinda dark) and, best of all, free! (Game is funded by optional microtransactions for special blocks and blueprints to make structures.) PROS: - Tons of blocks to decorate and build.- Different layers and biomes to explore.- Great graphics! sunshafts and high res textures. - Teleporting, so you don't have to walk back to places if you've built the teleporter. - Hotkeys can be changed! - Graphics can be lowered! - You can tame animals; farm them or just have them follow you around. - Great soundtrack! - Easy multiplayer! You can even keep it private by adding a password. - Friendly for people of all ages to play; very forgiving upon death. - the ability to claim chunks of land, lock chests/furnaces/extractors, and so on.- Rotate blocks with the 'R' key! -------EHH- Sometimes light sources glitch out and do not provide light; digging up blocks nearby fixes it, but it can get rather annoying, especially in the dark. - Pets set to follow do so very closely; they do NOT help in combat. - requires Wifi to play.- Lots of block variety can cause inventory to become very messy.-------Overall, very nice! Worth a shot to anyone looking for a block-y game or just wanting to kill time.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Already loving this game! I'm not even a Minecraft fan, but this is just different. The worlds look great, and the game is super fun with friends. Take out the mining aspect of MC and replace it with more futuristic building. Using left click to use your glove and teleport materials to you, and right click to materialize the materials. The controls are perfect, even better than Minecraft. I honestly went into this expecting a ripoff, but found a game I enjoy way more than MC. There seems to be a lot of items to craft, and lots of enemies and animals to fight. The servers are also flawless. Took my brother not even a minute to search for my world, find it, and join in. You also start with 300 coins, so you can buy a nice building set to begin with, I got the Aztec temple looking set. Made an awesome base with tables, goblets, a throne, chests, torches, etc. I hope they add more to the character customization, though. Right now you can only change your hair and skin colour. I wish I could wear accessories and change my haircut. Anyway, I definitely recommend this game to anyone that wants a casual but fun game to pass time with pals. :)

content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
Early Access Review
Early Access Review | May Be A TL;DR Review, You ChooseAs a fanatic of the hit title Minecr**t, I enjoy sandbox, voxel, RPG-esque, games. I figured I would try out Creativerse just for the giggles. Little did I know, or expect, that the game itself is being constantly updated w/ features that even novices can get in to. I fell deeply in love w/ the game's easy to use UI, it's easy to use crafting system, it's "brief" like tutorial system, it's hover to get a description" deail pattern and it's addictability. Though I may not have a lot of hours, I haven't felt this feeling with crafting. building and powning my enemies, since an unformentioned "Huge Update" in Minecra**t. I enjoy building, crafting and defeating enemies again, over and over. This is what Minecra**t should strive to be, or beat, in terms of user friendly play and repeat value. I strongly suggest hopping on this bandwagon as soon as possible, so you can witness it's evolution and growth too!My Personal Opinions of the Title/Game | Pros vs ConsPROS: Extremely easy to use and friendly game, crafting, building, battle, interface. Well drawn art and details. Lower-End PC compatibility (Ggraphics card wise; make sure you meet the CPU minimum first). High replay value. User appealing items and gear. Interesting crafting sstem w/ recipes at the ready w/ upgrades. A plethora of materials, eneamies, worlds to share, social activities and more! Peaceful soundtrack and ambient background sounds. PvP ready. Custom worlds ready and editable. Amazing graphics.CONS: Takes forever to get what you need through advanced crafting (time based crafting system; nothing happens easily). Early Access is unpredictably long process and the updates are massive (takes a long time, at times, for the updates to download). Some Beginning Game enemies are too OP and need to be nerfed. Too easy to cheese enemies for , and gain materials. Not too much of a challenge, once you get a hang of the absolutes and controls. Things aren't things, until you're face to face w/ them (i.e. "Insta-Death") Limited Item Space on character's person.The RundownAll in all, the pros, IMO, outweigh the cons. So I believe this title/game is a must have for anyone who is looking for a visually stunnig, slightily challenging (when it comes to enemies), playful, fully socialy interactive, self sustaining, Minecr**t-esque, sanbox, voxel game. I believe this game will be going places, lots of places, in fact :3

content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game can be compared to Minecraft due to similar gameplay, but there are obvious differences. There are a vast amount of blocks and building materials, and blueprints are great for building large structures. Exploration is definitely something to do in this game. The caves are insane, there are tons of breathtaking biomes, and multiple underground layers allow for deep underground exploration as well. Also, the night sky is so beautiful in this game! There are so many unique, rare, and resource-loaded mobs that have varying levels of difficulty if you enjoy combat. One thing this game has that Minecraft doesn't is a pet system in which you can tame any animal you want and take care of it to obtain valuable resources. My favorite aspect though is the steady pace of gameplay. This means that starting out is not a complete grindfest but it also prevents the player from skipping really far ahead quickly, making it constantly engaging. Would definitely recommend playing this game with friends!

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								A lovely game to fill in that Minecraft-shaped void in your heart! Creativerse has no greater objective and no major bosses to find. You simply exist to create and mine things as you please! It is in general very soothing to play (unless you're digging in the deepest layer, which is kinda dark) and, best of all, free! (Game is funded by optional microtransactions for special blocks and blueprints to make structures.) PROS: - Tons of blocks to decorate and build.- Different layers and biomes to explore.- Great graphics! sunshafts and high res textures. - Teleporting, so you don't have to walk back to places if you've built the teleporter. - Hotkeys can be changed! - Graphics can be lowered! - You can tame animals; farm them or just have them follow you around. - Great soundtrack! - Easy multiplayer! You can even keep it private by adding a password. - Friendly for people of all ages to play; very forgiving upon death. - the ability to claim chunks of land, lock chests/furnaces/extractors, and so on.- Rotate blocks with the 'R' key! -------EHH- Sometimes light sources glitch out and do not provide light; digging up blocks nearby fixes it, but it can get rather annoying, especially in the dark. - Pets set to follow do so very closely; they do NOT help in combat. - requires Wifi to play.- Lots of block variety can cause inventory to become very messy.-------Overall, very nice! Worth a shot to anyone looking for a block-y game or just wanting to kill time.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Creativerse shares the sandbox genre with Minecraft.Most people will say it's a clone. I say let them. To each their own,right?Pros:- My potato pc can run the game just fine.- The graphics are really nice.- Updates about every 3 weeks.- Talkative devs who listen to the community.- Nice variety of blocks.Cons:- Servers are online only,which some people will probably dislike. I don't.Some players need to understand the difference between some things like F2P,P2P,P2W - and the recently added Creativerse Pro (which is a one-time price of 19€ or something,that allows for extra features that are,by most players,described as Pay to Win.)It contains the ability to make more than 1 world,a glider,a flashlight,additional world options,2x stamina and probably more stuff I can't remember.Do you like the genre? Try the game for yourself then. Enjoy!

Early Access Review
								Listen, many people are putting the thumbs down♥♥♥♥♥♥with this game due to it being " a minecraft ripoff " however just becuase it looks like minecraft or consists of blocks doesnt mean♥♥♥♥♥♥ i saw a dumbass say "Its a rip off of minecraft down to the CODES" what are you some ♥♥♥♥ing genius? you can see the codes of both games, well in fact it isnt dumbass and if it were thn the crafting, monsters, gameplay, and shapes would be the same however, you ♥♥♥♥ing minecraft degenerate, isnt. there are ♥♥♥♥ing curves 9isnt in minecraft) and the crafting is much more complicated. monsters arent the same and there arent the same items in this game tham minecraft. in fact i peronally think this is a better game than minecraft since it doesnt crash every ♥♥♥♥ing time i load it. also stop being a ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and thinking you know everythin you eleven year old prick. this game is a very good, well managed game Although some glitches it is still a very nice game. i would however like to see differnt ame modes like minecraft and the ability to add plugins.and maybe make it easier to obtain better gear. but other than that a very good game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Great game if your looking for a sandbox game that isn't minecraft! easy to set up servers for yourself and friends also none of that coding marlarky! So easy and simple to do and to get to grips with it's also much easier to protect and less likely to have your account stolen...I find that creativerse is much more secure and safer as you can choose a password for your world and whether or not it's public. It's perfect for me highly recommended but buy the full version :D definetly worth it as it's a heck of a lot cheaper than minecraft which is £20. so happy days for a cheap yet effective game so far as I can see can't fault it :D It's worth getting a pro account as it's just so much simpler to add worlds for yourself or friends! There were other sandbox games before minecraft before everyone freaks out about it. Most sandbox building games will have a similar layout as it's the easiest one to create. And if your gunna complain still make one yourself! :D It is by far the easiest game where sandbox games are concerned and it is easier to protect your builds and worlds from grief.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is an amazing game.  I can see everyone's dislike of the changes to the free play version.  There are some I don't like either, but $19.99 is not a bad price for the full version of the game. I've bought other games that were supposed to be complete for far more, and wished I hadn't. At least they don't charge a monthly charge like some other online games which I won't mention.  I would recommend this game to anyone wanting a free online game, with the opportunity to upgrage later. Obviously they are not finihed with the game. This is my opinion of the game and its changes. Everyone has a right to their own opinion. If people really don't like the changes, then they should contact the dev's and let them know, instead of dissing them on social media.

								This game, was one of those games I never tought it would "grasp" me so tight, I was really amazed of it. I have bought the pro feature after few hours of gameplay and I must say every cent worth it. I have also brought my friends in this beautiful universe and we are all having fun in it.The wiring system is very interesting and it is a thing that appeals even to grown-ups. You really can do a lot of things, you can let your imagination and thinking romp, you can have a pleasant and chill time, spiced a little bit by the adventure and fighting.Definitely would continue to play.Just give it a try!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5
Early Access Review
								Why would you play this game?Creativerse is a multiplayer sandbox game, which in itself is nothing new.However, as you progress in the game, you unlock certain items of a higher tier and - in turn - will help you to gather better quality material and new tools.The players in this game are all in all very friendly and helpful. While I knew nothing about Creativerse in the beginning, a few friendly fellows explained to me the basicsand what I can do (thanks again! ;)).A few functions I dearly miss in other good sandbox games are included in this one: Taming monsters Blueprints Crafting Teleports (without installing plugins and such)And more...Sadly, while playing the game, a few minor bugs appeared:- when teleporting back to base, the surrounding doesn't load sometimes (invisible blocks)- (only with the bought Pro version) the glider glitches while flying slightly upwards with boost- while building a blueprint, the place where the firepits need to be have a graphic bug with the smokeBut all in all with Creativerse being an early access game: TOP! :)

content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm saddened by negative reviews. At first I was hesitant to try it out because of them, but I still played the free version and loved it so much I decided to support the devs and buy pro.I found out that the game used to allow free players to create more than 1 world and modify certain settings (which now can only be done with pro version). Now that it has been taken away, I can see why it angers so many. However, do notice that this game wasn't always free. After a while, they decided to make it free to play so more people could try it out. Those who bought it early on or spent even 5 dollars in the in-game store received pro for free with the R33 update. So I don't believe the devs are being unfair, they're simply finding out ways to make a profit for the hard work they put into this game. That being said, I would recommend trying the free version first, keeping in mind that it is still early access and that bugs are constantly being fixed. For some it works perfectly, for others it keeps crashing, so be sure to check the system requirements and adjust your game settings accordingly. I really believe it is worth a try. If you still don't want to buy the pro version, the game is completely playable without it. There are many things to explore and discover, and there are always ways to make the most of this game without having to buy it. For instance, if you want to build in many different worlds, ask your friends to play and each of you will have a world. You can join their worlds and they can join yours. You can also join public worlds and contribute to their community builds. In my opinion, part of this game's charm is playing with others.

Early Access Review
								Looks like a cute modern minecraft with better animations and much more interactive UI.It's actually a horror game. I can't stop shatting my pants. Some enemy is dangerous at day. Most is dangerous at night, but it's okay you are pro. But the mines! The mines are filled with deathtrapes and lurking AI waiting in the dark to rush you down! I remember the first time. I thought they can't climb through the 1x1 hole! Than I saw a blue light and fallen down. Soon I was surrended by eyes and horroristic morbid faces! I was running trying to fight, but they are much much stronger, faster and better.After that, each moment is a passing nightmare. Every ambient sound, every bit of growl! Is that my steps? OR IS IT THEIRS.I live on the top of the trees, with security, with traps and bombs attached to everything. But it's just not enough. You are NEVER SAFE.Good game though.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Pros:1.  Its Minecraft with good graphics.  The one reason I couldn't get into minecraft was the bleeding from my eyes it caused.  I also couldn't stand the faggy arm thing.2.  Good set of tools and craftables so far.  Took me forever to find out how to make twine however (hint...it comes from vines)3.  Lots of monsters so you don't feel alone even when you play alone.  Not a 'living' universe like No Man's Land will be, but much better than Barrens chat4.  Free.  Thank God for a free early access game (as they all should be instead of us paying to be their alpha testerrs!)Cons:1. The Melee Combat is faggy right now.  Not much too it...you just zerg what you want to kill and spam attack and hope you don't die but you will die alot.  No skill to it at all.  Don't try to dodge because you can't unless you get a mile away or stick the mob in a corner.2.  Has a store with 'p2lookcool' currency that I will never spend money on.  Sorry, cosmetics for a game like this just aren't cool enough.  Might as well go buy some flash cards for elementary kids so I can gawk at those graphics!3.  Character creation is limited  (generic really) between some typical male white kid I really don't want to be and some jailbait chick.  I picked the jailbait.  Give me a dark skinned person with an afro or asian or scandanavian or something.  Or just give me an afro at least.  *@$&.  Why does everything have to cater to Anglos/Caucassians?  That aside, there's nothing to improve the style of gameplay such as stats, perks, a level system, or ability boosts (which would be really cool for this type of game).4.   Fun for a while but it begins to feel like you're working a job after that.Final Verdict:  I reccommend since it is free!  Its fun and can be nice playing with others or by yourself.  Hopping from trees to collect beeswax is pretty cool and risky (since you die from falls).  Hopefully the game will improve its battle and character creation systems.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								If this game cost money i probably not recommend it because it is currently feel like a missed opportunity. What is done is well done and working, bugs are rare. Graphic and game mechanic is good. Yet it should offer more for people who like to explore and love confrontation in PvE. Crafting and finding a way to poses better armor and swords is absolutely a fun, but beyond that the rest is volunteer work, no need no pressure. You can grow things for fun and build things for fun, and buy blocks in the store for fun and be creative. If you decide to not, you will be just fine. If this game ever have survival stile gameplay I gladly play for it. Because not much alternative is around for those who seeking block based games with good graphic + RPG elements and loads of useful recipes + enemies + challenging combat and exploration etc. Yes, good mods are there for Minecraft yet the graphic and combat mechanic is SUX. The competition if there any really (other than 7 Day To Die) is not worth to mention yet, because most of them is under development and may never get finished, or pushed out incomplete. So i suggest to try out this beauty and experience it, and hope one day it turn out as a lovely game with good mod support.
